reviews.review:
A great little family beach. A short walk along the coastal path from the main Manly Beach is this wonderful little sheltered beach.
It seems much more suitable for families given the sheltered nature of the beach and the water.
It was also a good bit quieter than the main beach on the day we visited.

Lovely beach. Away from the crowds of the main beach at Manly and a short walk along path to Shelly Beach. Bay water is more protected so ideal for younger families to swim. Restaurant and kiosk available for meals.

Beautiful day at a protected beach.. This was the meeting place for an Eco tour we had booked and it turned out to be one of the features of the afternoon. The Boatshed Cafe/Restaurant was in a great position on the beach and the food was lovely. It is a very protected beach from strong winds, and has group BBQ areas for family fun!

Shelley Beach is a Special Beach. Shelley is one of the very few north facing beaches along the Sydney coastline, and is nicely protected from big waves or the southerly wind, so safe for kids. It has a lovely and lively cafe/restaurant (particularly on weekends) and is an easy walk from Manly along the beautiful waterfront. Or you could swim from Manly to Shelley if you are a decent swimmer, about 750m one way. Lots of fish to enjoy along the way if the water is clear, and in winter/spring time, look out further and you could see whales. There were quite a few breaching this morning, when I went for my regular swim this morning, magic!

evening picnic. Just love Shelly Beach.Very busy on weekends. Great restaurants. Water great for swimming and snorkelling. We often walk to North Head and then back and have a picnic in the evening. There is also barbeque facilities.

Small but beautifully formed beach. This is a lovely sheltered beach, great for young kids, a short scenic coastal walk from Manly beach, we had to take a short detour (along Bower St) as part of the coastal path was being repaired after the storm damage - beautiful properties here if you get the opportunity to see them. There is a lovely bush walk towards the back of the beach which takes you up onto the headland overlooking the northern beaches and you must try The Boathouse for a coffee or milkshake!
Pretty little beach . Perfect for little ones or people who like no waves. Right near look out and great restaurant. Only a short beautiful water edge walk from manly beach itself

Small and peppy. Such an awesome beach to go! A perfect place to hang around and with your friends. A small close walk from famous Manly beach, with a view of Manly beach. To add to the beauty, there is a small public pool to have fun.

Pretty alternative to main beach. A short level stroll from the main beach leads to this very pretty smaller beach. There was a popular restaurant there which was very busy with customers and a number of BBQ facilities. A really lovely spot to walk to.
Beautiful place. It's a small beach, close to Many beach . Great vegetation and amazing water color, if you like walk and beautiful views, it's great

A great swim if you're feeling like an adventure. You can actually swim from Manly to Shelly beach. It's a decent length swim so you need to be comfortable with mid-distance swimming. But if you are, it's fantastic.
Cute . When visiting the area, I recommend going on the Manly to Shelly Beach walk. The views aren't as impressive as the Bondi to Coogee walk, however it is beautiful none the less
Beautiful...but average. Its a great little hideout for a quite weekend but definitely not a must visit in my opinion. Its beautiful like every other part of Sydney.

Small, quiet beach. This small quiet beach has everything that AUS has to offer. A somewhat hidden beach with plenty of room along with a great view of Manly Beach just up the road. There are the usual Aussie amenities like tables and grills. This country really does a great job with their public spaces, making them safe and user friendly.Shelly is an easy and picturesque walk from Manly. Maybe 10-15 minutes.

This is a very pleasant little appendix to the big Manly beach.. This is slightly separated from the rest of Manly but easily reached via a short coastal walk. When the conditions are right surfing and body surfing at the point can be excellent and thrilling.

Hidden treasure in plain sight. Beautiful little beach tucked away from Manly hustle and bustle, popular with the locals is is accessible from the road and down a walking track, not wheelchair friendly unfortunately. Secluded and calm, perfect for an afternoon dip or playing with the kids, attractive rock formations on the Northern Side and a walking trail back to Manly from the Southern end.
pretty little side trip when at Manly. a charming little protected beach, away from the surf of the main Manly ocean beach... great for young families...

Another stunning beach !. Even though pretty much deserted in the winter (except for walkers along the paved path from Manly Beach). this small cove is a lovely spot to visit. All along the walkway are artworks built into the stone...fish, scuba divers, octopi, etc...and in summer, a saltwater pool is filled by each high tide. Worth the ferry ride over !

I really like Shelley Beach snorkelling. I've been kicking aorund Manly and Shelley Beach for a bit and the quality of the snorkelling (like any outdoor activity) is a gamble. Sometimes the sea is a bit rough and it will be harder to see animals as they will be in hiding. Other times it is magical, I've seen cuttlefish, trigger fish, puffers, various rays, many fish I couldn't identify and even saw some (harmless to humans) blue whaler sharks. I really like it.I'm sorry the people above had a bad experience, but that can happen. I find people to be quite nice and once I lost a flipper (I went out when it was a bit too rough) and it was out on a fence where I could retrieve it 2 days later, someone had retrieved it for me when I was unable to. On good days it's magical. My goal is to see a sea dragon!In winter you can rent things like wet suits if you need it (the water is about 16c in the winter - but as you swim around there are warm spots in the water you can warm up in).

Underrated cute little beach. It's not enormous but that's part of its charm - a local suggested I go to Shelley Beach instead of Manly Beach, and I'm glad I did! Definitely check out The Boathouse for lunch while you're there, right on the beach - prices are a little cheaper if you get takeaway, and there are plenty of picnic tables to eat at, or just take a seat on the beach.

Sheltered Beach near Manly. Shelly Beach is approximately 15 minutes walk from Manly, but the main walking path was wiped out in severe storms in June 2016 and doubt it has been reinstated yet. We visited in March 2016 before the storms. The beach itself is a lovely sheltered spot and very popular. A wedding was taking place when we visited on a Friday afternoon. The beach is also the site of the very popular (and great) Boatshed restaurant which offered a wonderful range of drinks and food.Hopefully the walkway, toilets and interesting sculptures along the walkway will be reinstated, as if you are are visiting or staying at Manly, a walk to Shelly Beach on a sunny day really is a must do.
Hidden gem, usually uncrowded. Locals snorkel here, it's calm and quiet. Also lots of parking and eateries nearby. Can get married in the gardens.
Hidden gem. Nice little beach hidden away and often used by locals. Worth a visit though the walk there is a bit hilly
Small Beach. Small beach near Manley. Between the two there are scenic road. The beach is much calmer and with less visitors from Manley.

Nice walk out to the beach and it is a lovely small beach.. It is nice to walk out from the main beach at Manly to Shelly. Cyclists, walkers, runners all share the path. There are lovely views of the bay as you go too and it is nice to stop and look back. There were children in a surf club group in the water which was entertaining.

Really gorgeous!. Shelley Beach is really gorgeous! Great add on when visiting Manly, as so close to each other. Lovely restaurant/cafe there, and lovely walks up to the lookout. Definitely worth visiting.

Top waveless beach. Secluded cove and mostly no waves to speak of. Lots of scuba groups learning. Ideal for young children. Even have gas barbeque available on beach for use. Clean sand and smallish area which can get crowded in summer. Minimal paid parking but easily accessed from Manly about a 10 minute walk. Repairs behind done at present so access a bit difficult but should be completed soon.

Beautiful Beach. Shelly Beach is a delight. It is only a short 10 minute walk from Manly (at present they are repairing damage to the path). The beach is protected so the waves are generally not very big, making it ideal for small kids. There is a grass area behind the beach which is great for picnics or there is a restaurant and kook where you can buy snacks. The area is part of a marine reserve, so there is no fishing. This makes it good for snorkeling or scuba diving. If you don't feel like walking you can drive there and walk down. At the lookout it is only limited parking with a 2 hour max. There is a nice walking path around the point above the beach.Love Shelly Beach.

Favourite Beach in Sydney!. This is a stunning spot for a day at the beach! Manly has always been our favourite beach until we walked around to this little gem. It is perfect for swimming away from the surf yet all of Manly's amazing amenities are right there. Get there early on a beautiful day so you can secure a good spot. You can also do a wee walk around the point which was really nice.
Good beach. It´s a quiet place, at least when i was there. The waves are quiet small, so maybe is ideal for the kids with an adult supervision.

An Overnight Delight. Shelly Beach is one of most pleasant experiences I have had. Camping out and seeing the sun set. then awaking to the sound of the water, birds and then running down for sunrise on the beach. I highly recommend a visit!

This beach has everything you need, isn't too crowded and is worth taking your snorkels. Nice beach, not too crowded, has cafe and kiosk, clean toilets and is worth taking your snorkel to.
Can be driven to or reached by ferry. Parking tight.

A delightful walk around from Manly. Shelly beach is a sheltered ocean beach, you can ever walk around from Manly or park in the carpark above on the headland. A lovely spot for a swim, walking or a meal. You can picnic or visit the Boathouse.
Relax!. Love walking to and from Shelly Beach. It's a great area to practice paddle boarding and to just chill. The view from Shelly Beach is amazing to see on a good day.

Small beautiful beach. From Manly beach you can take a short walk to this small yet beautiful beach. There is also a restaurant out there right at this beach. You will get a scenic view of Manly beach from this location. If you love trekking, you can go up to the top of a rocky cliff from this spot. It is a greatly recommended place for short trip guys to Sydney.

Swim & Dive. A ten-minute walk from Manly Beach, Shelly Beach is a small and charming beach, where you can enjoy swimming or scuba diving (operators in commercial Manly). Facilities such as barbies, toilets, showers and a kiosk.

A great little protected swimming beach. Shelly Beach is around Marine Parade from its big brother Manly Beach. Generally more protected and not a crowded as Manly, its a great family beach with nice clean sand.
Great for swimming. Had inclement swimming conditions at Manly so came swimming here instead, beautiful beach with great facilities nearby
always a beautiful walk. Recent Storm damage to pathway presently being repaired .. Always enjoy the walk, often see the water dragon lizards sunning them selves watching the passing visitors
Great walk. Best walk along the ocean from Manly beach to Shelly Beach. Very short..maybe only 15 minutes. Shelly Beach is much smaller than Manly beach with great little cafes.
more secluded. a bit of a walk from manly beach. its a bit smaller and more intimate. small cafe right on the beach. hard to get to with the coastal path closed due to erosion damage

Cracking little beach. Amazing view back over to manlyfrom the beach. Clean white sand and clean water. Not allot of amenities around with the exception of the boat house which is always packed and over priced. A good little walk to the point (5 min) for more spectacular views. great fatty out and the breech is well protected so no big waves. In summer, get there early as gets packed. There is parking at the beach but is paid. Only a 10 minutes scenic walk from manly corso.

Beautiful Swimming Spot. Steely Beach is a great swimming spot away from Manly Beach itself. There's a marine reserve here as well, so the snorkeling and scuba diving is quite good. You'll see wobbegongs and PJ sharks, as well as many other fish species. The visibility was amazing when we dove here.

Parking is a nightmare.. If you are lucky enough to find parking, then have fun and enjoy. Not my cup of tea, but if you need to get it off your bucket list, do it quick like a bandaid. The snorkeling and diving is relatively good, considering you are in a centre of a 5mil city. But apart from that I don't see all the fuss. However, if you connect the visit with a coastal walk back to Manly (where you are more likely to find parking), then why not.

As good as a Mediterranean beach !. My favourite beach, just a ten minute walk from Manly's main beach, where you can swim and snorkel and see plenty of colourful fish, as this is a protected marine area. No wonder the scuba diving schools are often there. Protected from the surf, it is perfect for families, it also offers a grassy area, with BBQs, and plenty of shade, and the walk from Manly surf club is extremely picturesque. Of course, showers and toilets are available, and a classy cafe/ restaurant is there also if you want to spend the day there.

The best shore-diving in Sydney. Although La Perouse runs Shelly a close second, Shelly wins out on the beauty of the location, the protection (you can dive here and still have pretty good viz even in quite wild weather) and the diversity of the wildlife. Everything from white-pointers through to seahorses and once, a weedy seadragon! And it really is a beach dive - you kit up and walk in - no rocks to trip over on - legendary!

Quiet seclusion. Quiet place for a get together or just a relaxing day. Very nice place to swim or snorkel as the bay is protected from the main ocean. BBQ facilities and toilets available. Within walking distance of Manly beach.

Favourite spot in Sydney. The is my favourite spot in Sydney, I love coming here in summer and winter, the time of the year is not important as you will find this place magical anytime... Beautiful, clear water, good snorkelling and perfect BBQ spot. The walk from Manly to Shelly is also beautiful and relaxing, I have done it hundreds of times and never get bored with the stunning view of the ocean. Dream place to live!:))
Shelly Beach. Nice short stroll from Manly Beach/Corso (15mins).Boathouse is a great lunch spot and you are able to walk up to the headland and the wider ocean/Manly views are awesome.

Beautiful Sydney secret. This spot is magical in the winter when the wind blows from the south. Its protected and the local food joints have been recently revamped. great for a long lunch then a walk into Manly
Lovely walk on a sunny day. Like Cornwall in the sunshine!! Beautiful houses perched above the pathway! Nice little restaurant called The Boathouse there too!

A visual delight. After taking the ferry over from central Sydney we did some walking along the ocean side of Manly. The Shelly Beach area houses some nice el fresco dining spots which we tried for our mid day meal. The surf was pounding and the surfers were plentiful along with some novice scuba divers taking intro lessons. The grassy areas were jammed with mid dance picnic folks and included those of all ages. Bring a picnic, buy a sandwich and beverage and sit on the lawns or dine with ocean view in the shade. Opportunities for all age and all levels of activity.

Hidden gem in Manly. Shelly Beach is tucked into the Cabbage Bay (marine reserve), just to the end of the Manly Beach. Its just a few minutes walk from Manly's Corso and is a really pretty spot.The beach is small, and has a number of little restaurants near it, as well as BBQ facilities. We saw quite a few people snorkeling and diving as well as swimming. Definitely a good place to spent a sunny day
Beautiful.... Had never visited Manly before however I fell in love with this area. Am looking forward to having more getaways here.

Shelly Beach and a girl named Shelly. Shelly Beach is a nice quite cove beach at the south end of the long stretch that is Manly Beach. When I was first in Australia about 10 years ago I met a Canadian girl named Shelly on that beach and we had fun together. This time around I am much more mature and just enjoyed the scenery at the beach (limited as it was due to it being winter now but still some hardy types out here). In the summer it is a hopping good spot for adults/18+ as the evenings can get rowdy.
Walking from Manly to Shelley Beach. A lovely easy walk from Manly to Shelley Beach and make time to have something to eat and drink at The Boathouse
if you wanna see corals, go there. I went snorkelling there and saw nice corals. The beach is also a little bit hidden, so there are no waves :)
Gorgeous beach with great snorkelling. Gorgeous beach with great snorkelling, super if the main beach is too crowded, and a lovely walk too.

Level walk with sublime views. Begin your walk at the South Steyne Surf Club, which is located at the southern end of the manly promenade. The walk skirts the water around to Shelly beach, passing Fairy Bower beach along the way. It is mostly level, with only a slight rise near the beginning of the walk. You can stop for a drink or meal at the Fairy bower cafe or finish with a swim at Shelly beach which is part of a marine reserve with few waves. The Boathouse Restaurant is here for light meals during the daytime or a classy restaurant at night.

The best beach. I love this beach. Although Manly is beautiful I find this one is great for snorkeling and swimming. The beach bar serves great food. Although this beach gets really busy at weekends and bank holidays.

Beautiful views and walks. Lovely spot for a Sunday morning walk to Manly or vice versa. Nice eateries at either end . Nice wide paths towards Manly or a little bit more rustic with bush tracks heading towards North Head of Sydney HarbourBeing late autumn despite how inviting the water looked we didn't not venture in(no wetsuits etc) but there were plenty of people enjoying the activities on offer - Surfing, paddle boards & divers.. If it was summer we would of been in there too!Nice part of Sydney
Lovely beach with Manly views. Heading to busy Manly Beach? Why not take the coastal walk to Shelly? On a hot day the water is so clear, so refreshing. This small beach is a delightful find.

Shelly Beach Aquatic Reserve. Shelly Beach is a beautiful secluded beach a short walk from Manly Surf Beach along a coast track that has amazing scenery. The beach/bay itself is an aquatic marine reserve so the snorkelling hear is unexpectedly great for such an urban area. Take a picnic lunch and enjoy the shade under the tree filled park. For those with extra energy, walk up the hill and take in the scenery of the northern Beaches from the headland.
Snorkel & Diving. I love this place. Hardly ever see a wave break. Heaps and heaps of fish. Great spot for snorkelling and to learn to dive. If you're lucky you might even catch a glimpse of a shark

Great beach for kids.. Shelley Beach is great beach for kids as is sheltered. Along path where rocks are is great for snorkelling as coral & fish are plentiful. Boathouse restaurant is nearby & another cafe further up path.

AMAZING!. Such a beautiful little area! if you are visiting the northern beaches/Manly you MUST walk to shelly beach! in the summer you can catch whale/dolphins in the bay and it has a yummy restaurant there too! only advice is be careful at night as it is very dark walking along the path, and some weirdos do hang out here...
One of the best place for snorkeling in Sydney. Great Aussie beach for snorkeling. the beach is beautiful, especially when you come on the good weather.
Must go here. take the Manly Ferry to Manly beach, walk to Shelly beach , hang out, go for a Snorkel , its a beautiful walk and beach

A smaller beach within walking distance from Manly. I just love going to the beach and Shelly Beach is a smaller, more quiet beach just close to Manly. What a pity I did not swim at Shelly, I should have brought my swimwear along to enjoy it.
Amazing beach with it's very own style. Shelly beach may be the most unique looking beach I've seen in Australia. I love visiting Shelly beach, great spot to relax in the sun.
Nice walk to a little gem. Great beach for snorkeling and swimming. Has a nice little restaurant right next to the beach if you want food and full bar service.
amazing place. if you wanna go out the sea, that's the place for it. it has the best place to snorkeling and just enjoy the great ocean!

Lovely beach, busy and cosy. This beach is great for BBQ, snorkelling and volleyball. The water there is usually warmer than at Manly beach, less waves and depending if the direction of the wind, less windy too.
Gorgeous little beach. I love this beach, perfect walk around from Manly along the cliffs. Nice cafes along the way. The snorkelling from this beach is perfect!
Gorgeous beach. Small beach. No waves. Child friendly. Gorgeous setting. Rocks to climb. Cafe and kiosk for food and drinks. Very relaxing.

Euro style beach. Sheltered from the ocean waves, it offers european-style beach experience. Has interesting rocks for snorkeling. Also gets quite crowded on weekends. Nearby kiosk/s & restaurants are not cheap, but you kind of expected that eh?
Gorgeous Spot to see in Manly. Take the ferry, take the walk, go for a swim, have a bite, people watch and Chillax in a really cool spot!

Popular spot for a swim or snorkeling . Just a 10 minute walk from Manly Corso, Shelly Beach is popular for locals and tourists like me. I'll definitely keep coming back to this family friendly small but lovely beach. Great for swimming and snorkeling with food and drink spots near by.

Nice afternoon. Visited on a Sunday afternoon,very busy. Used one of the 2 free barbecues but had to wait an hour and a half for it. Went snorkelling and saw some little sharks amongst other fish life. Plenty of scuba divers there too. Managed to get parked but short on places.

Such a lovely beach. Strolled here from Manly. Well worth the walk, which is made interesting by the little sculptures along the way.
Pretty beach, plenty of room, great place to chill out.
Good diving. Shelly Beach has good diving by Sydney standards, in the summer months its actually a nursery for Dusky sharks, and winter time you may find a Giant Cuttle fish if you are lucky.
Lovely spot. Lovely spot to relax and enjoy the sun, even in the Australian winter/ spring. Walk from Manley along the promenade and stop for s bite to eat. You can go on from here to the Head.

take some snorkling gear if you can. you can swim in this bay amongst some really pretty fish and coast line great walk from manly and back stop at a pretty cafe along the way you could be in the mediteranean some where its so idyllic

A pretty sheltered beach. We went to have lunch on Manly beach, but the wind was quite strong. Noticing a path around to a beach facing a different direction, we decided to go and see if it was better there. Arriving at Shelly beach we found a lovely small beach that was very sheltered. It had a cafe and also people scuba diving and snorkelling . It was a lovely place, with little or no wind- perfect for lunch.

When in Manly. If you`re ever visiting Sydney you simply must explore Manly and its beaches aswell. Manly is just a half hour ferry ride from downtown Circular Quay. Even though the main attraction might be Manly Beach I would reccomend Shelly Beach. Shelly is less wavy and more bathing friendly than plenty of others. The sea is not very deep and there is nearly any currents at all (if any). Surrounded by enjoyable nature. Pretty popular beach for the locals but not many tourists - I think. If you want to get a nice spot make sure you`re early. Bring a towel!

Great beach and can be used by snorkellers. 10 minutes walk from Manley, this is a great small beach, which is very safe and looks across at 90 degrees to the much bigger Manley beach. The area is also known for good snorkelling.

Lovely visit. This is a lovely area and we had a nice walk from Manly (the ferry terminal) and takes about 20 to 25 minutes to walk along the path to Shelly Park. We had a nice smoothie at the cafe and then had a quick walk through the bush area on the point back to Manly again. A really nice expierence.

Lovely small beach. We walked to this beach along the coast/prom which only takes about half and hour or so from Manly beach and encountered lots of lizards on the way.We were there in January and the sun was hot and had a great day and also had a meal (fish and chips) in one of the restaurants which was really good value for money and tasted lovely too.

Beautiful place and beautiful walk from manly. An amazing walk thats not long but still beautiful from manly to shelly or vice versa is worth it. The beach itself is an really nice place to swim or to just relax
My favorite beach in Sydney . Just a short distance from Manly beach. This was a much quieter and swimming friendly place. Not for surfers. But really nice and beautiful little beach. I love it

practically attached to Manly Beach but a world apart!. Queencliff is terrific and Manly Beach proper is a hive of activity but Shelly Beach offers something completely different and very special. Despite the surfer crossing sign at Shelly it is better suited for swimming, snorkeling or quiet sunbathing.Situated beneath the Shelly Headland it is much more tranquil but a short walk along Marine Parade from Manly and the Corso. If you want to really get away for a bit, follow the path up to the Shelly Headland lookout and see a vista of the whole Manly area

Always beautiful !. Shelly Beach is absolutely gorgeous & as a local I never tire of this stunning beach.The walk from Manly has to be one of the best in the world for coastal views. Shelly Beach is also known as Cabbage Tree Bay which was named after the Cabbage Tree Palm. The most interesting aspect of Shelly beach is that its the only west facing beach on Australia's east coast and is filled with unique marine life such as the Eastern Blue Groper, the Weedy Sea Dragon, Gloomy Octopus and Little Penguin. The bay is popular for scuba diving and snorkelling because of its clear and shallow waters.  It is a very sheltered beach so it is especially safe for families and children. There is also plenty of facilities with toilets, cafes, & the now famous Boathouse Restaurant. If wanting to have breakfast or lunch it can get extremely busy so its best to arrive early. The walk from Manly Life Saving Club to Shelly beach is very scenic & beautiful. A great place to take numerous photo's of Sydney's coastline.

Never felt so relaxed....gorgeous. I walked up to Shelly Beach from Manly and I was greeted with the most beautiful and relaxed beach. The water here is beautifully calm as it is sheltered away from the main beach and there's a cafe where you can buy coconuts and sit on the beach and drink the water straight out the coconut.....some would say that's a little piece of heaven. Can't wait to return...

good place for shore diving near Manly. Did two shore dives from this beach with Manly Dive centreInteresting safe dive with variety of fish and fiddle rays with a large blue grouper who followed us around (Bluey) Cuttlefish and dinky whaler shark and a variety of reef fish.Showers and snack bar there and benches for dressing and changing tanks Paid Au$125 for two dives includes transport from Manly

Great little beach. A great beach with the surf shielded by the rocks. With no surf it is good for snorkelling and swimming especially with young children. Very close to a cafe too with easy parking and a good starting place for a walk into Manly beach of further afield.
Wuaint. Perfect spot to relax, look to the north at Manly beach and just chill out. A little beach with lots of rocks and fishing. Great cafe close bye and a great walkway. Terrific for families
Beautiful beach just a 1/2 mile from Manly.. This beach is beautiful for swimming and sunbathing, it faces West so it is great in late afternoon.

Great little secret. Many Sydney Siders don't even know this beach exists. You can drive and use the car park above the beach or walk from Manly (preferred) around the ample walkway which starts near the South Manly Surf Club. There are couple of food outlets at Fairy Bower and one larger venue at the beach (The Boat House). There are public toilets and shower facilities. It's a beautiful small beach facing North, so its usually very flat and calm and great for kiddies and non-swimmers.

Love this beach.. Gets very crowded in Summer. But, I still love it. I can lie on my towel and hear just about most European languages, so it's also popular with tourists. Many families with small children as it is calm -no waves unlike Manly. Great for snorkelling, a great break for long boarders on the point, there's grass and shady trees at the rear of the beach. It is serviced by a good kiosk albeit quite expensive. There is also a great Resturant if you want to gaze over the beach and the chrysal waters. What can I say...I love this place.

Lovely spot. Great place to be for a relaxing time on the beach, with nice cafes around and hot plates for outdoor barbecues, but the paths leading up to it do get pretty congested at peak beach times...

Neat little beach on Manly. Take the ferry to Manly and walk left. You'll go down the sidewalk to Shelly Beach. It's smaller than the manly beach, but has shallow area for kids to play. The sidewalk along the way has a short wall embedded with silver replicas of sea creatures. Definitely take your camera to capture this unique art work.
Beautiful. Lovely cove type beach with parkland at the back, great for snorkelling, quieter than Manly and less surf.
Perfect for children. ...also great for learner snorkelers. A real gem. One of the (many) reasons I always recommend Manly over Bondi to visitors.

Quiet Reflection. When the Chaos of Manly Beach is to much to take, a quick stroll with have you at Shelly Beach, which seems like a different planet, let alone a different city. The ocean is protected and generally quite calm. A perfect place to come and get away from it all. I feel like I am giving away a local's secret, but it it too beautiful not to share.
A little piece of paradise. A beautiful walk to this sheltered little beach. Water is clean and beautiful. Truly a favourite of mine.

Stunning beach so close to Manly and the city.. One true treasure of Sydney's Northern Beaches. Lay on the beautiful sand, swim in the clean ocean water, snorkel, surf (when the swell is right), or hangout at the Boatshed Restaurant/Cafe. Its a great day. Protected from most winds.
Nice beach but small and popular. Very busy when we got there- popular location for schools? Anyway there are other quieter spots nearby

Gorgeous, calm beach. Shelly beach was my favorite spot. The clean clear and calm water makes it great for families and snorkelers. Bathrooms and showers are right there. We only wished there were SUP rentals. The boathouse restaurant is great too

The best beach in Sydney. I just love Shelly beach, it is perfect for the family and young children as the swell does not come round the point. It is also well protected from the wind when the on shore is blowing. We really enjoy walking around the headland point to the lookouts at the top too. It is a great place to be.

Lovely beach tucked away. Spent an enjoyable afternoon at this beach, snorkeling and swimming in the calmer waters. The beach is tucked away at the eastern side of Manly beach, sheltered from the waves that crash onto Manly beach. Saw some sizable fish along the waters edge by the footpath and also some water dragons which was interesting. Would highly recommend to families with younger children if you didn't want big waves crashing around you.

part of Manly Bay. Beauitful beach, much smaller and quietier than Bondi. Beautiful beach, much smaller and quieter than Bondi but more attractive and great for stroll, family picnic or barbi. Great day out

Lovely safe beach. A short walk along the seafront from Manly this is a little jewel of a beach very popular with surfers and sunbathers alike. It now also has the benefit of a café/restaurant which was under construction the last time I visited and although I did not eat there the menu prices were at a bit of a premium and you would be paying for the view.

A nice walk from Manly. This is a lovely, smaller beach walking distance from Manly beach. The walk itself along the shore is very nice. There are often snorkeling/diving classes going on as this beach is protected and less surf-y, which also makes it a good beach for smaller children.

Love it!. In 5 months it will be my 4th year living in Australia, every summer since my wife and I arrived to this wonderfull country, we enjoy going to Shelly Beach, the water is the best, the walk from Manly is picturesque, I love it. I would like to take the challenge of swiming from Manly to Shelly, anyways 100% recommended if you come to Sydney...definetly Shelly beach is a must!
Shelley beach Manly. Stunning day out on such a pretty beach easy walk from Manly Corso my boyfriend and I had a wonderfull afternoon, very clean and recommended a hidden treasure

little beach, quiet and peaceful with a great cafe. stopped by after a short walk from Manly Beach. Very easy stroll, and there's a nice path on the other side of Shelly Beach with nice views of the ocean too. You need your walking shoes, but it's well worth a visit if you want to get away from the major tourist draw of Manly Beach

Quieter than Manly and A Delight on its own.. Shelly Beach is an easy walk from Manly (which was closed because of rip tides), along a promenade. It is a lovely, small beach with people of all ages and all backgrounds.

Lovely beach setting with BBQ facility. A beautiful secluded beach during the week. Gets busy on the weekends though, with parking problems. A lovely coast view from an elevated area on the edge of the parking area. A long walk from the ferry dock.

Great Getaway Beach During the Week. On weekends the beach and area can get packed, try to go on a week day. Take the time to do the walk to Manly along the waterfront. Also try the lookout at the end of the carpark at the top. The carparking fee is very heavy so try to get a free park a little further away and walk.

Beautiful!. This is a short walk from Manly beach. Whereas Manly is a beautiful crowded urban-like beach (not to be missed), Shelly is a relatively secluded cove with calm clear water, great for swimming, even snorkeling. I highly recommend Shelly and Manly.

Shelly Beach, please don't tell everyone about this gem !. Lovely clear water, Gorgous beach and a rewarding walk from Manly. If you want to BBQ facilities are available st the back of the beach. Cafe and toilets adjacent to beach. And the water was calmer here than at Manly, so better for anyone who's not a strong swimmer. Plenty of local wildlife on the walk from Manly, and a popular route for joggers, cyclists, skaters and walkers. There was a scuba diving class nearby, so plenty for everyone at Shelly beach.

Magnificnet. We came across on the Manly Ferry and by chance walked around to Shelly Beach. We think its better than Bondi Beach. It was beautiful. We had lunch in the little café. An extremely pleasant day.

Much better beach for swimming than Manly. I prefer coming here than going to Manly as I am a swimmer not a surfer. The water is much calmer so you don't have to battle waves to get into the water.There's also a really good restaurant next to the beach, The Boat House. It does take away so you can eat on the beach, or you can eat in too.
Wow!. An absolutely stunning beach! Its quite small but is very beautiful! The water was very clear and we loved this beach!

One of Sydney's best beaches. It is a small beach but one of Sydney's best. The water is crystal clear most days, great cafes and restaurants are close by. Bondi is not a patch on this lesser known beach. It's a gentle stroll from Manly and is a magnificent family beach.

Worth the walk. Manly Beach is beautiful. Shelly Beach is worth the walk from Manly Beach, especially if you walk through the parking lot and venture yo the Pacific side to see the beauty of the opening of the harbor to the Pacific Ocean.

Beautiful and isolated. We met some friends here for a day at the beach and were surprised to find this was more of an isolated cove than a stretch of beach. It seemed perfect for families with young children, though. There's a sandy area at the beachfront and then farther back, there's a grassy hillside. The walk from Manly Beach to Shelly was beautiful, as well.Sadly, there is limited food and drink available there so bring whatever you want to consume, else you will have to go on walkabout to find something.One drawback - there's apparently limited parking there. We took the ferry to Manly from Sydney and then walked to Shelly, but the friends we were meeting were driving in. It took them more than an hour to find parking, and even then they ended up parking practically back at Manly.
Relaxing Place!. This beach is for everyone specially to all the young families. It's only small but it's a place a nice swim without waves. Beautiful place you gonna love it.
Stunning Shelly Beach. If you are in Manly do not miss visiting Shelly Beach. Visit the cafes and wander along its pathways looking out for the metal sculptures along the way.
Shelly Beach. A very nice clean beach. Very clear water with lots of amenities as well as two cafes. Short walk from MAnly Beach

A delightful walk. The walkway from near the Manly Surf Club to Shelly Beach is a delight. It is very popular on the weekends. There are a couple of cafes along the way or you can bring a picnic and sit on the grass or benches and just take in the view across the ocean towards Palm Beach. Beautiful.

Great beach for young families. This beach is sheltered and would be good for young families. Just a short walk from Manly (15 mins from the Ferry wharf).
There were some blue bottle jelly fish there the day we were there, so care does need to be taken around this area.

Great for snorkelling. This is a lovely little cove beach. It's only small but it's a nice place to swim without waves, and a great place to snorkel. It's a protected reserve (no spear fishing) so you'll see a huge variety of marine life.
Go on a clear day, and walk along the main Manly beach to get there.

Perfect for young families. For a perfect morning, walk the length of Manly Beach and keep going along the walkway to Shelly Beach -- a great destination! Small and safe, it's perfect for families and has the added benefit of the park and its facilities being right on the beach, as well as being car-free. The Boathouse café is a winner as well, with kid- and adult-friendly food and drinks to eat in or take away. A beautiful spot enjoyed by locals and visitors.

If you don't want waves.... Shelly Beach is a nice relaxing beach to go with a few friends or family. Fairly quiet unlike the main beaches you go to which is good for people who wants to get away from the crowds. Although, the downside of going here would be the parking. It is in a residential area with very tight streets due to cars being parked on each side. Best to get there early.
Beautiful beach!. This is a quiet little alcove where families and beginner swimmers can come without fear of being ripped out to see.

Small Gem in Manly. Shelly Beach (also spelled Shelley Beach is a small beach on a tiny cove at the southern end of the more famous Manly Beach, in Sydney.I lived in Manly for many years and Shelly Beach was a favourite place for my wife and I to take our two kids, because it is protected on all sides, by North Head to the south on the landside, and a reef to the east on the seaboard.Many years ago I used to scuba dive and snorkel and can attest to the wonderful sea life just a few meters below, because this is a protected marine reserve and there are severe penalties for anyone caught fishing or spearfishing. There is also an old motor bike on the seabed in the middle of the cove in about 8 m. of water.Manly Council has installed two electric barbecues (open fire bbqs are dangerous because of the proximity of native bushland on North Head). With some friends we took advantage of these during my last visit back home in June.But we had to wait to throw our steaks and sausages on because the beach has become so popular that you sometimes have to queue for the barbecues.There are public toilets and showers. There is also a kiosk selling snacks, soft drinks and coffee.T

Great beach for families. Shelly Beach is a sheltered beach around the bay from iconic Manly beach, around a 15 minute walk. On the walk itself, there is plenty to see - large water dragons, sunning themselves on the rocks, as well as small sculptures of the various forms of marine life. There is plenty of shallow water for small children to splash in, as well as deeper water further out which seemed to be the playground for the many groups of divers and snorkelers that we saw. There are some shady areas under the rocks that form the background to the sandy beach, so really, something for everyone. Then there's the restaurant, of course. This is a much better beach for children than the larger beaches of Manly and North and South Steyne, because of its sheltered position. Will be back.

Cabbage Tree Bay Aquatic Reserve & Shelly Beach. Spent a few days in Manly last week including swimming & snorkeling at Shelly Beach & in the Aquatic Reserve. Even with a big swell running this area was relatively well protected & OK for snorkeling. Plenty of fish to see, small rays, blue grouper, some cuttlefish dancing around the kelp beds.The beach itself was busy on all days, probably partly because Manly Beach was closed on some days because of dangerous surf conditions. Well worth a visit for a walk, swim & a snorkel - good facilities & places to rest & refuel.

Eastern Water Dragons and Marine Life!!!. Just go there, you won't regret it. Take snorkeling stuff. Amazing fish and other Marine life! The best thing though was the amount of Eastern Water Dragons on the rocks on the way to the beach from manly. They're so cool and really tame!!!

Best Sydney Shore Dive!. I was surprised to see how much marine life this beach has underneath. I went for a guided shore dive in to a chilled 14degC water during winder but can't complain with the scenery that I've seen. The place is so accessible by car but going by bus or ferry saves you the hassle of finding a parking spot. Worth visiting!

The first of the Sydney Northern Beaches and the most protected from the ocean.. A small well protected beach with plenty of shade and space for family picnics and now with a new build Boathouse restaurant and kiosk. Add to this the fact that it is also very picturesque and easily accessible by the oceanside walkway from the South Steyne end of Manly main beach it is also very popular. Parking at the beach is both limited and expensive especially on weekends. The alternative that we use if we are only intending to go for coffee or a meal is to park in the free Council car park underneath Coles supermarket and walk the delightful 15 mins to Shelly and back which still leaves plenty of time before the free parking expires.
Looks like a great place for families. It was pretty busy when we went, lots of families. We did see a few divers there. Unfortunately that day someone died there diving and there was a thunderstorm.

Beautiful beach popular with families. Admittedly, the beach did get crowded but for good reason. It is calmer than Manly Beach. There is also an adorable restaurant called the Boat House with sit down or take away available (highly recommend the berry smoothie). Additionally, take a stroll up the stairs toward the cliffs and find some of the best views of the ocean. You can also see surfers catch a wave at the break at the far end of Shelly. I didn't do this, but the spot is very popular for snorkeling because of the sea life and calmer waters.
Stunning . I've been all over the world This is the most stunning place Cant fault the natural beauty Yet in the city areaHow lucky am I to live in Sydney
Sunny Day Attactivity. By far a beautiful walk from Manly Beach to Shelly Beach with a view to eating at the Cafe' that's on the water. Kids can swim and enjoy a casual day out.

Small, clean beach in Manly. Shelly Beach is worth a visit in Manly. It is a small beach surrounded by higher ground but easily accessible from Manly. There is a small, protected sea water pool just along from the beach itself. Manly and the harbour area around Sydney is prone to visits from Sharks and so one should take the warning signs (when out) seriously.
Stunning though can get busy. Great beach, snorkelling and diving location and now with the restaurant / coffee shop reopened a nice place to spend a few hours
A must if visiting Australia. Beautiful walk way, beautiful restaurants, and heaps of active people walking their pooches, and even say G'day!

Snorkeling with big groupers and cute port Jackson sharks.. Have had the opportunity to go snorkeling here in summer and winter time, and loved it. Had luck enough to see one of the awesome port Jackson sharks in the winter, and this time I meet a little school of puffer fish and a lovely big blue grouper :)

Small sheltered safe beach. Shelley beach can be accessed easily on foot from Manly via a beautiful walkway. You can park up the top of the beach if you are carting picnic stuff or small children. The beach has coffee and food facilities plus toilets. The water is calm no waves as it is a protected north facing beach. It is good for snorkelling.
Nice enclosed beach, popular with kids!. A short walk from the Manly Surf Life Saving Club along the beachside walkway. A lovely beach popular with kids and right next to the Boathouse Cafe!

A Gem. A short walk from Manly along the beachside (or a short drive if you prefer - but parking could be an issue!), this is a lovely and relatively protected beach that's excellent for snorkelling and exploring the Cabbage Tree Bay Aquatic Reserve.The walkway itself is pleasant, with a number of quirky sculptures lining the way, and the possibility of seeing one or more of the protected Eastern Water Dragons basking in the sun.There are plenty of places for picnics and a few public barbecues available.I would also recommend that you take a walk in the bushland of the Shelly Beach Headland and enjoy the views of surfers at 'the Bower', a famous surf break.
A pretty little beach. Shelly Beach is a much quieter and smaller beach than others one often hears mentioned. Safe and attractive, a pleasant place to take a break,

Nice, little beach. The beach is nice. No big waves. Unfortunately it is crowded. Near the beach there is nice small cliff. You can observe the surfers and you see Freshwater an Curl Curl beach as well.

New Years Eve. Went there for lunch with family group only to discover that the Boat House closed at 11.00am ????WE got there at 11.15.So we had to cut short our stay and left about 2pm. Went to Criniti's in Manly...glad we did..excellent place and almost empty !!
Away from the shops at Manly.. A walk along the foreshore, keep a lookout for native animals carved from stone, stop for coffee along the way and arrive at Shelly Beach.

Scenic little beach near Manly. Very nice and scenic beach at the end of Manly Beach. we had lunch here, as well, while overlooking the beach. Many scuba divers seemed to come and go from Shelly Beach there apparently being some excellent diving to be had. This beach is great for people watching, too. Quite a walk in from Manly if you've arrived by ferry but worth the effort.

Walk your troubles away. I was born and bred in Manly so I have walked from Manly Beach to Shelly Beach a thousand times to go either for a surf or snorkelling. It would take approx. 1 hour there and back. Whilst there make sure that you walk up to the car park at the top where you can take in a spectacular view of the Pacific Ocean. At Shelly Beach itself you can look back at Manly & Queenscliff Beach from Ocean aspect. Also at Shelly Beach there is a restaurant there, how good it is I don't know but always busy, but with a view like they have, no wonder!

Our introduction to Sydney's beaches. We arrived in Sydney in the morning and our family took us to Shelley Beach that afternoon. It was a great way to stay awake for the rest of the day after a 15 hour flight! As it is winter back home, it was a delight to go swimming on a nice sandy beach while we received news of a snowstorm in New England!

Hidden Gem. I recently walked from Manly to Shelley Beach then up onto the headlands behind it, and back down a hidden rainforest walkway, completing a delightfully diverse circuit. Shelley Beach is just a little beach, with some surf, but not as much as on Manly. Nice restaurant and kiosk, picnic areas, and short walks around the point and up onto the cliffs. It takes about 10-20 mins from The Corso (the main drag spanning the distance from Manly Ferry to the ocean).
Great beach, over croqded. Has grown in popularity last few years with the Boat House re-opening. To many people and not enough amenities. The beach however is beautiful.

Classic protected ocean beach. Great beach on which to relax, take a dip, snorkel or launch a paddle board - not for surfing as there is no break - go back to Manly surf beaches for that activity. Enjoy the sun and cool off in the calm waters. Get a snack or lunch at the Boathouse Cafe.
Lovely walk from Many Beach. It was really a nice walk from Manly and Shelly Beach is not a busy. It's great because it is smaller and more peaceful and fun for the kids to look around the rock pool.

A hidden gem in Manly. We love Shelly Beach. Also known as Cabbage Tree Bay, it is a marine nature reserve. Best accessible via walking from the south end of Manly. It looks far at first but the walking track (footpath) has such beautiful views, you reach Shelly Beach before you know it. The kids love walking there, particularly at sunset. We have snorkeled there but advise against going into the water after heavy rainfall due to poor water quality (there are signs advising this as well). From Shelly to Nth Manly it is a great way to exercise and take in some of the best views Sydney has to offer. Highly recommend!!

Nice walk from Manly beach...... A nice walk from Manly Beach which is accessible by ferry from Sydney harbour. Shelly beach is a marine nature reserve and is quite small but has plenty of facilities such as toilets, showers and restaurants. Plenty to see along the way and we also managed to spot a water dragon sunning itself on the rocks.

Christmas at Shelly beach. Good for Family very quiet easy swimming situations it difficult to park but it was a very beautiful quiet beach rock pool was very enjoyablePerfect for a day out and not too far from major Sydney areas

Excellent beach with calm water near Manly. This is a little beach at the south end of the main beach which is a 15 min walk from the Corso. It is protected from the wind and the waves, so that the water is calm. It has a quite good restaurant, a kiosk and not much else. I consider it a better place to swim and relax because the water is calm and it is newer crowded as Manly beach can be, especially in the restricted areas where you can swim.

The Not So Famous Beach that Can. If you come to Manly, get off the ferry and march down the Corso to the world famous Manly Beach, you will have a great time. It's an awesome active place.But if you take the time to spend a day or two in Manly...or a week if you're wise, stroll over to nearby Shelly Beach. It's small, sheltered, the sand is course (Shelly Beach, shells, get it?), and their are no shops to speak of and a couple of restaurants. However, it's a calm, protected, friendly and inviting beach with children playing in the shallows, snorkelers near the rocks and divers heading out to the deeper edge. There are also a few jungle hikes of varying distances with great views. Don't miss these either.Manly beach is fun. Nothing wrong with it. Yet, you feel like an insider local if you spend a day or two and take in Shelly Beach.
nice, little beach near Manly. It is a 15 minutes walk from Manly Beach, beautiful scenery, nice tropical plants and flowers. The water can be cold since it is at the point further into the ocean.

Calm waters, packed on a sunny day, horrible parking. A beautiful area of sydney, attracts many snorkels and scuba divers. On a nice weekend, the beach is covered with people, making the traffic terrible, with little parking options. Be aware rangers are about waiting to fine you if you exceed the 2 hour parking limit around the area.The beach itself is calm, but hidden rocks in the water make it a hazard for your toes and little ones learning to swim. Nice and close facilities, with outdoor shower, toilet, bbq, and cafe.

A hidden Sydney gem. If you are seeking a sheltered beach that is easily accessed with great views over the iconic manly beach this is for you. You can drive then and park on the heads but parking is limited. Get there early. The other option is walking around from manly. The area is a marine reserve so bring a snorkel and goggles as well as you sun cream. A short distance from shore near the white buoy the dive school leaves up to mark the reef are where the fish live.

Love this beach. We Love Shelly Beach so clean and great for the kids,only one thing its ok going down but a bit of a sandback climb when coming up its easy if you're fit!!.nice cafe too,plus the Resteraunt is open upstairs,

The small beach. This at the end of Manly beach there is a lovely cafe and toilets it's good for swimming and snorkelling it's not as busy .You tend to get more family groups at this beach it's a very clean beach .The cafe is good for all day catering and is very popular and you will not be disappointed with it .

Mild nudity and young families. There always seems to be half naked girls tanning their torsos on the beach right next to expectant mothers and their toddlers. I just don't understand it. If you go early enough in the morning, it is a great place to hang out at. The walk from manly to shelly beach is my favourite!

it's wonderful. loved this beach it's secluded but with a lot of character. really wonderful. there's cute cafes and shops . really great vibe. loved it.and it's a walkway to the national park terrific.
Clean and Great Snorkeling . Check out the local fish, and the local coffee. Beautiful beach. Calm water and great for locals and tourists. One of the best beaches on the north side.
Small but beautiful. Everything here is under preserve. The beach has so many shells and the sea life is amazing. We went snorkeling here it is a must.
Worth The Walk. You cannot go past this oasis. Well worth the 20 minute walk from Manly to get to this shelterd beach. Cafe and toilets are close by, a lovely walk.
Beautiful place but always very crowded. I love this place. Every time I go to Manly I walk to Shelly beach. The walkway is very beautiful and there are many cute miniature statues on the way

Lovely. l actually prefer this little sheltered beach to the much bigger Manly beach,which was quite windy when l visited,this beach was sheltered and got really hot.A nice little cafe nearby,and you can lead off from this beach to the North Head Walk,which is worth doing.

Shelley beach. Nice walk from the ferry. Pretty beach small. Can snorkel or dive from this beach. Had a very nice lunch at the Boat house which has recently been refurbished. Sat outside looks over the beach.
Great local beach. Seemed to mostly be locals, loved that the waves were calmer, but the water was very kelp-y. Nice restaurant on the beach.

shelly that little gem you find now and then. its a super walk from Manly along a busy walking track with dogs, kids, swimmers , skate boarders, runners young and old, along the way the view is perfect so get out those camera phones and snap away.. little coffee place and gift store along the path, a salt water pool!!! yes clean toilets so its enjoyable, Shelly is small but very safe and is always busy.. The boat Shed is amazing so maybe book for lunch one day, but don't forget to pop up the stairs and look at the view from Cabbage tree now that's breath taking
Hidden treasure. Short walk along the coast from Manly Beach. Lovely sheltered spot and no shortage of eateries along the way.

My favorite beach in Sydney... You just take the Manly ferry over to Manly Beach and walk along the boardwalk which is lovely, to Shelly Beach. Shelly Beach is a little cove of a beach..more private and beautiful..there is also a great restaurant close to it..

Best kept secret in Sydney. This is snorkelling heaven - the most amazing fish can be scene in the bay including some very friendly Blue Gropers who seem to really enjoy the swimmers and lots of other fish.

Shelly Beach is a must on your trip to Manly. As mentioned in my Manly Beach review, when visiting Manly and walking around to Fairy Bower , Shelly Beach is great for a swim & snorkel / dive as its a great marine park ..BBQ area by the beach to cook your own lunch....Also can drive to Shelly Beach if you go by car,
Very pretty Beach. Lovely little beach accessible by a gentle stroll from Manly Beach. Views are lovely and plenty of seating along the way for weary walkers or purveyors of the scenery.
Beautiful. Gorgeous beach as are the majority of them in Australia. Brilliant way to pass a sunny afternoon away!

Very calm beach. Great snorkling and diving spot, the water is calm and a bit warmer than in the rest of Manly and if you are lucky you can see some cute tiny Nursing sharks. Its also possible to do BBQ.
Nice spot with bbq. A nice little beach with some public bbq. Just bring your meat and it's a lovely place to grill your stuff and eat it at the beach.

One of the best parts of a visit to Manly. If you come to Manly Beach, make sure you do the easy promenade along the fairy bower to Shelly Beach. Having first visited this beach as a child, it still continues to amaze. A quiet cove from the rough and tumble of Manly surf it's a favourite for divers and young family's and the view back to Manly is gorgeous.

The best beach in Sydney . I know it's a big call. But I stand by my choice, after 8 years spent checking out beaches in Sydney I can safely say this is the best one! Why? It's not continuously windswept, the ocean water is not always freezing, the waves are not constantly trying to kill you nor is the marine life, although you do have the occasional shark. It's excellent for snorkelling and diving. On Sundays arvo the club Burning Manly organises fire shows, you can have a yummy BBQ and have a drink at the local watering hole, The Boat House. Popular with expats. Love it!

Not so nice . Although it's got a lovely cafe and a BBQ it lacks good soft sand, cleanliness and energy. Manly next to it is lovely and taking a walk up from Shelley to the rocks and view point is nice. The beach itself is rough - each to their own
Nice spot for a leisurely swim. We stopped for a coffee at the Boathouse after a short but lovely walk from Manly Beach. What a beautiful part of the world!

Shelly Beach. When visiting Manly most people out for a walk will end up at Shelly Beach, a beautiful little beach which is busy every day. Little cafe's are located along the way with great views, visitors to Sydney would love this little beach.

Lovely walk, not too touristy. Shelley Beach seemed so much less touristy than Manly Beach. The walk from Manly to Shellly Beach winds past houses a few local restaurants. There is also a "pool" that has been built into the beach, it offers a safe place for children or people, like me, who cannot swim in the ocean.

"the best way to start the morning". In the morning, the sun not at his top, the best way to start the morning. Sitting on a bench nearby looking over the beach, looking at the waves. A lovely way to begin the day.

Interesting short walk. It makes for an interest although short walk. We caught the ferry to Manley and headed through the town to wards Shelly beach. It has some interesting sculptures. If you are lucky you might sea some water dragons sitting sunning themselves on the rocks.

Shelly Beach at Manly. One of the best surfers beach in Sydney near Manly... Make sure you have adequate preparation to go and surf... Do not surf in the evenings or late evenings. Best advised time is around 8AM to 2PM ... Later as the day goes, Tides are bit high causing sometimes scary situations that might affect you. Learners and Experts to do surf during the mid days... Good beach for walk, relax bath, watch out for rocks in the beach before you dive.

A. Lovely Walk to Enjoy While Visiting Manly.. While visiting Manly we took a walk from the main beach to Shelly Beach. It was a lovely way to enjoy the great ocean view and was a very easy walk suitable for all ages The day we took the walk it was very windy but to our delight path was very protected We enjoyed looking at the sculptures at the side of the walkway and stopped for a coffee at the Restaurant before our return.

One of Sydney's Best Kept Secrets!. This would have to be one of Sydney's best beaches. Calm and relatively peaceful. You'll have to paddle out if you want to catch some waves but closer to shore you snorkel with the fish and enjoy the sun.
A lovely Walk. The walk to Shelly Beach is a lovely scenic and not challenging walk, can get very busy when the weather is nice, well worth the time to take in this walk if you are visiting Manly
Simply stunning!. This is one of my favourite little beaches in Sydney. It is always busy but you can see why when you get there. Fantastic spot of to scuba dive or have a picnic

A wonderful walk to really beautiful beach.. I have been to Manly many times but never before had I walked to Shelley Beach. I was keen to go there because as a teenager living in South Australia I had read about the Fairy Bower surf break in many of my old surf magazines.today it didn't look anywhere a scary as it had appeared in magazine images all those years ago. The walk was really pleasant with plenty of interesting things to see on way-Eastern water dragons, small sculptures placed strategically along the walkway and cafes that had a European feel about them. Along side the walkway in the water there were bathers, open water ocean swimmers, snorklers and scuba divers. Once at Shelley Beach the views back towards Manly are spectacular.It is a really good walk.
Beautiful! . We took a lovely walk from the Ferry to Shelly Beach. The walk is easy and very beautiful. In summer it gets very busy but worth it!
Take the walk. A fantastic walk around Manly Beach, right from The Corso.A great place to sit and watch the Ocean and people.Good restaurant at the end as well!
Great walk. Brilliant walk along the shore .... see crabs ... molluscs and water dragons as you walk this wonderful coast. Crystal clear water. Good wee restaurant at the end too!!
Good swimming sheltered swimming.. Very good beach for safe swim with family. Lovely cafe nearby. Good views clean beach. Water crystal clear. Interesting rocks nearby.

Beautiful easy walk. Well worth the walk around from Manly, stop and enjoy the view, stop and have a coffee and if you remember your swimming costume have a swim in the little rock pool on the walkway.

Great spot for swimming, snorkelling, eating or BBQing. Shelley Beach is awesome for snorkelling, one of my favourite spots around Sydney. Great, small beach, with small waves (as it is a bit sheltered from the ocean swell). Family friendly. There is grassed area with public bbqs, and of course now the newly opened Boathouse for fine eating. Public toilets and showers, and you can take a lovely walk through the bush up North Head from here. Only downside is parking in Summer.Love this place!

Such a great spot!. If you're looking for a peaceful spot to hang out with family or friends, then look no further. A quiet, sheltered beach, shade trees and barbies provided, what more could you want? Oh, coffee? Ok, there's a cafe there with coffee, tea and lots of other goodies. Plenty of parking up the top of the hill and only about a 6-7 minute drive from Manly CBD. Remember to get there early in summer time and don't forget your camera! Enjoy!
lovely little beach. lovely little beach, perfect for families and as well others. The walk from Manly to Shelly Beach is nice as well and you can stopp for coffee on the way.
Wuite possibly the best beach in the world. Shelly beach has everything - Delightful Sand, Natural Wind Shelter, Superbly swimable Seas, stunning snorkeling opportunities - all just sensational.

Fun town. This is a big beach area, with a nice flat area coming into the beach so the waves aren't too big close in and the young ones can safely boogie board. The typically beachy businesses line the streets: restaurants, ice cream parlors and bikini and board shops.

Great western facing spot for sunset. I've been to Shelly beach several times and my favourite time to go is just before sunset so you can enjoy it from the beach. It's an easy walk from Manly and popular for tourists and locals. You can also scuba or snorkel from the beach but I haven't tried those yet.

Hidden gem. i used to live in manly and loved taking the walk to shelly beach past all the water dragons. Wonderful little spot for a relaxed afternoon. Take a walk up to the cliff top we spotted some black cockatoos!

Gorgeous location !. As a local I absolutely love Shelly Beach. The walk from Manly has to be one of the best in the world for coastal views. Shelly Beach is also known as Cabbage Tree Bay which was named after the Cabbage Tree Palm. The most interesting aspect of Shelly beach is that its the only west facing beach on Australia's east coast and is filled with unique marine life such as the Eastern Blue Groper, the Weedy Sea Dragon, Gloomy Octopus and Little Penguin. The bay is popular for scuba diving and snorkelling because of its clear and shallow waters.  It is a very sheltered beach so it is especially safe for families and children. There is also plenty of facilities with toilets, cafes, & the now famous Boathouse Restaurant. The walk from Manly Life Saving Club to Shelly beach is very scenic & beautiful. A great place to take numerous photo's of Sydney's coastline.

Sheltered Shelly. Lovely sheltered beach which can be accessed from Manly along a lovely coastal path. Well worth a visit when you go to Manly - doesn't take long and feels like you are away from the hustle and bustle.

A local favourite - Shelley Beach. Walk from Manly Beach along the promenade to Shelly Beach. Have a coffee or meal at the newly opened Boathouse Cafe/Restaurant. Walk up to the top to spot whales (in season) or dolphins or even a seal at times!
protected and pleasant beach. actually not a bad dive site. Our only west facing beach on the east coast. A small secluded spot, not bad little cafe. Busy in summer

Near Manly. If lounge sand beaches are not your thing, and you prefer small, less crowded, cute beaches, this is the place for you. The walk from Manly main beach is excellent and you can see lizards and seals (ah, yes! also some surfers! :-)

Lovely beach, great for swimming. Oh, I should have selected 1 point to keep this place a secret :) Lovely beach but sadly no facilities or shade - a drinking water tap would be really nicely welcomed.
Easy walk to a gorgeous little beach. A must-do if visiting Manly- the walk is easy and relaxing. Great view of the beach, rockpools, and ocean.
Little Gem. beautiful little spot, its hidden away and not to busy from the crowds of manly. Beautiful clear water to go diving and swimming. Stunning views.
Beautiful. A beautiful little beach suitable for snorkeling or little ones paddling. A beautiful spot to spend some time.

very cold even in summer. +really have lots of shells everywhere but be careful cause they are quite small and sharp
-the public toilet was under renovation at the time when we were there

Snorkeling with Port Jackson sharks. I came to Manly on a day when the waves were too big for me to be comfortable surfing, so I did some snorkeling at Shelly beach instead. The visibility wasn't that great because it had rained rather heavily a couple days prior, but I did see some cool fish and several Port Jackson sharks when I went in the morning (not man-eating, I promise!) so I still had a great time. I've been told by locals that this is also a place you can sometimes spot a sea turtle and squid.

Best Beach in Sydney. This is my favourite beach in Sydney, a small beach next to manly beach in between the trees. It has a nice view over manly beach. A really good place to relax or have a BBQ. Went here several times and cant get enough of the place
A lovely, tranquil spot.. A beautiful little beach, with its own white rock pool. We used to go here as kids, and it's just the same!

Biked to Shelley beach. Please note you can only take biked on the bike path to Shelley beach on weekdays! On Weekends and public holidays bikes are forbidden. Main reason is that this is a very popular walk and when there are hundreds of people on the path you end up walking anyway. The beach and shining beach hut are very pretty. Well worth the treck.

A beach thats straight from a postcard!.... It doesn't get more beautiful than Shelly beach... A small secluded beach round the corner from Manly beach, filled with cafes along the way, its a glorious spot that you must visit! Plenty of amazing walks right to the top of the rocks for amazing views!
A secluded little beach. Shelly Beach is a little gem in Manly. Protected by the waves, this little beach is perfect for families and snorkellers. However, in the summer it can get really crowded
great snorkling for Sydney. great little beach to go snorkel or scuba dive from the shore, and a big variety of sealife can be spottet here.
Shelley beach manly. Shelly beach is south of manly walking south , fantastic scenery worth walking up to the monastery on the headland , need good walking shoes as it is quite steep in parts

Beautiful as anywhere in the world. Shelly Beach is a short walk from the ocean end of the Corso in Manly and like a little oasis at the end of the walk. You can see the surf rolling in at Manly as it faces back towards Manly but it's a very different beach. It's mosty calm, still water, perfect for snorkelling or swimming with younger children or people who aren't big on the waves. The snorkelling is amazing as the area is protected and there are so many fish. Just off the point there are some resident groper. The beach is picture perfect though and really enjoyable if you don't touch the water. We regularly walk there in winter and every time feel pleasantly surprised by its beauty.Shelly Beach is protected from the southerly and South-easterly winds and perfect when those are blowing. Don't venture there if a North-westerly is blowing though. It'll be far from picture perfect.Also, even though the water can be very calm, watch the little swimmers as the tide can have a bit of pull underneath.There is a new restaurant there which looks absolutely amazing and also takeaway coffee. I haven't tried the restaurant though so can't comment.

Hidden jem. This beach is located over at Manly and take the ferry and it will take you another 15 minutes to walk to Shelly Beach. It is just beautiful - what you imagine every Australian beach to look like.

Take the lovely walk from Manly to Shelly. The walk from Manly beach to Shelly beach winds along the coast for about 1 km and is paved all the way. The views are outstanding and the path is dotted with sculptures and signposts making the walk most interesting. Shelly beach istelf is a lovely serene and secluded beach - looks like a location for a movie about a deserted island.

Cote D'azur down under. My father who was a well travelled European gentleman spent much of his early years on the French and Italian Mediterranean. He said that Shelly Beach was more beautiful than anything they had in Europe. I agree. This is a sheltered location protected from the wind from everywhere but the north. The beach is deep with hills all around just beyond which lies the Pacific Ocean. The beach has no waves but there are plenty nearby and the constant movement ensures that the water at the beach is always clean. There is an OK restaurant and crappy takeaway nearby so you won't starve and fresh water and showers on the beach. Bringing you own food highly recommended for both price and quality reasons. If you come to Manly by ferry (the best way) you then have about 30 minutes level walk to get here. The views on the way are excellent and beaches everywhere to cool down. Don'r leave Sydney without a ferry trip to Manly and Shelly Beach.

Manley's secret neigbour. From the right end of Manley Beach, there is a small path that winds along the shore, leading to this delightful, secluded beach. Much quiter than the main beach, the waves are generally smaller, making it easier for the swimmers amongst us. There is a fantastic restaurant that overlooks the beach, The Boathouse, great for brunch or dinner.
Picturesque easy walk.. Great walk with lovely restaurants along the way. A great way to reward yourself after a lovely beach walk.
Joys of Shelly. Shelly is so lovely; the leisurely walk from Manly and the perfect views througout the walk are so enjoyable. stay a bit longer for a snorkel or even a BBQ lunch.
Beauty, the Manly Way. Enjoy. This is a local secret, such an amazing little beach with stunning views onto Manly Beach. Fabulous restaurant The Boat Shed. A must to walk around the Grand Parade.

Walk from Manly to Shelly Beach in Sydney. This is an easy, lovely walk along the foreshore to a small pretty cove that is great for swimming all year round (although alittle cold in winter). Its popularity however is about to skyrocket with the opening of the Boathouse cafe/restaurant perched at the sand's edge. This is part of the small, really good Boathouse group of three restaurants on Sydney harbour. The crowds to get in are going to be enormous, fortunately it won't affect the beautiful beach area. You can of course drive to a car park above the beach, but the walk from Manly is so attractive, its part of the journey.

You might want to stay all day!. At the Southern end of Manly Beach you will find the very easy and very delightful walk to Shelly Beach. Enjoy the wonderful views out to sea and back to Manly along the way and in notime at all you will arrive at the very sheltered, very calm Shelly Beach. Relax, swim, snorkel or play beach sports. Very safe for young children!

THE spot for snorkeling in Sydney. Shelly is a secluded beach with no waves, perfect for swimming and snorkeling. It's packed with fishes: especially some huge blue gropers!The fishes are used to see swimmers so they don't hide at all.You get there taking a very nice path a the south end of Manly Beach.There is a bar/restaurant, bbq, toilets and the start of the North Head Manly walk.I often go there.

Shhhhh, Don't Tell Anyone About This!. This small family friendly beach is tucked away. The water is calm and the view is spectacular! My son went diving here and saw a Giant Cuddlefish! I sat on the beach and visited with many locals while he went diving. There is not much shade. There are bathrooms and showers available. If you need parking - get there early!

Manly. Bit of a walk to get there but well worth it. Ferry trip to Manly on Sydney harbour is just magnificent but stay outside up top for best photo opportunities. Dolphins are often found in the harbour and if you are lucky the odd whale has been known to wander in and perform for the ferries.

Sheltered beach - only norther facing one on east coast. Sheltered, nice swimming. Rocky sandy shore which can be a bit sharp on the toes. The beach is narrow but the sand goes back a long way. It is popular with families.

Family friendly beach that's not too crowded. We live not far from this beach, and its a favourite.Its family friendly,with BBQ facilities,clean toilets and changing rooms.
The highlight is the enclosed seawater pool,great for kids and oldies(like me) who are'nt strong swimmers.If its open, go to the Nun's Pool cafe opposite for coffee and cake.

lovely lovely beach. I wish I could go there every day. This is an unique beach. From there you can see the whole Manly beach. It is small but wonderful. I think I like to walk there seeing the landscape so beautiful. IT is a paradise.

Gorgeous and special part of the coast. This calm and secluded beach can be reached directly or through a walk around the rocks from Manly. There's a kiosk and toilets here and a generous amount of sand space. Shelly is set amongst the trees and has a country feel within the city. The water itself has a sudden drop from flat and shallow to quite deep. The bottom is (as the name suggests) made up of crushed shells. Parking can be really difficult in the season so be warned!

we went to a wedding one weekend, went back for lunch the next. fabulous food - the day was a bit wet but that didn't matter so much because we were there with friends. Bit of a hike to the car, but it was a lovely meal with very attentive staff
Easy, pretty walk with lovely restaurant and beach. like everything. Best Mon thru Fri due to heave pedestrian traffic on the walk there from Manly. Ideal beach for families with Tidal pool nearby

Great snorkeling. Great little beach for swimming (no waves). Fantastic snorkeling. Probably the best place to snorkel in Sydney. The gropers are super friendly. I actually patted one. Get there early in summer as it does get busy. Also a nice walk from Manly beach to get here. You can drive but parking is super expensive. Food options are limited so bring your own if your fussy :)

Great to walk around to; easy place to spend an afternoon. Small, reasonably secluded beach that is probably perfect for families wanting to be a little bit away from Manly.Really nice to walk over to from Manly too; great view of the ocean.

Shelly Beach. Last Monday travelled by ferry to Manly in full winter's sunshine with Sydney Harbour filled with its natural beauty, sailing boats and marine vessels. Arrived at Manly at 12 and walked from south Manly to Shelly Beach, about 1.5k of easy walking facing east looking out over the calm bay of paddle boarders, snorkellers and a few swimmers braving the cold waters of 17c.
