At Shelly Beach had lunch at the newly renovated cafe, Boat Shed, excellent position filled with a nice vibe throughout. On return walk found a quiet spot and enjoyed the sun. Returned by ferry back to Circular Quay.
Need a nice spot to laze. A must if you visit Manly, and a short stroll away, can be a bit busy at the weekend but nice and secluded from the madding crowd of Manly

An easy lovely walk to a charming little beach and restaurant. This is a lovely small beach, not far from the famous Many Beach. It is reached (if you travel to Manly by ferry) by heading up the Corso, then turning right and following the path along the main beach. You hug the water's edge (sand's edge. actually) andthe path is edged by stone walls, topped with quirky bronze statues (small) of marine life and humans enjoying the sea... a surfer, frogmen - quite delightful. And at the end, a charming cottagy looking restaurant, with tables inside and out, small ones , and large ones to share. It's now called the Boathouse, a sister venture to the one at Palm Beach. It was absolutely packed at 11:45 on a Wednesday, with food and beverages - I noticed that bubbly was a popular choice! It was n-o-i-s-y! The walk itself is flat and manageable, and sported a selection of happy pooches strolling along with their owners. A very enjoyable experience.

Pick a nice day.. A beautiful & peaceful bay amidst the surfing mecca that is Manly & Fairy Bower. Take your swimmers as the beach is safe and the water usually calm without rips or dangerous swells. An ideal location for that Aussie Day BBQ or 'any-day' BBQ for that matter? Perfect for kids and facilities are A1. Plenty of interesting walks are handy and in walking distance of Manly S/C.Make sure you pick a still fine day. South Westerly winds will spoil the experience.
Beautiful. A beautiful protected beach a short walk from Manly. Didn't get the chance to when I went there, but it looks like it would be a great place for some snorkelling.

Beautiful secluded beach in Manly. This is one of my favourite beaches in Sydney. It's small, doesn't suffer from the crowds of Manly (even though it can get a bit crowded) and it feels like a completely different world (somehow Brazil comes to mind).
must do. yes,yes.yes one of the nicest beaches in sydney, get there early on a hot summers day, also lovely late afternoon
go snorkelling. This is an amazing snorkelling spot, a nice stroll from Manly Ferry. Watch out for the Blue Grouper !

Trendies welcome. The walk from Manly Beach to Shelly is delightful, along the promenade, past the ocean pool, it's a visual pleasure. Weekdays are best, coz on weekends the beach and it's BBQ areas are crowded with trendies, backpackers, and dozens of 'beautiful people'........not my scene.
Lovely spot. Its a lovely walk from Manly beach to Shelly Beach. There is a restaurant at the beach for either a quick drink or a full meal
Pretty little beach. This is a nice beach to go to if you are in this area. Quiet, nice swimming and good areas to sit/picnic, etc.
Nice little beach. A nice walk there from Manly, enjoying the walk, the little restaurant there, the view, the walk up the hill and then back!

One of my favourites!. I love this little beach in Manly. It's quite chilled out, with a lot of families going there, mainly due to the relatively calm water. However, the best part is the excellent snorkelling. Snorkel along the left hand side of the water down to Fairy Bower and back and see if you spot the local gropers. Just wish it was easier to park here!

Shelly Beach Manly. Great bike ride to get to Shelly Beach. The beach itself is small and secluded, which was very nice if you want to relax and soak up the sun! The Boathouse restaurant located on Shelly has friendly staff and delightful meals. Will be returning.

Breathtaking beach!. I am not really a beach goer, but since the weather was warm for me i decided to take a dip into the water. The walk along the coast to it is lovely and i even saw a water dragon on the way.The beach is small but nice and the water is very calm and you can see everything. Saw a few fishes and even a sting ray! And if you arnt much of a swimmer its definetly a nice place to relax and read a book and enjoy the views
short walk to a quieter beach. Love this stroll past Manly beach. Look out for the lizards sunning themselves on the way. Great to take Children over to this sheltered spot
nice beach. It was a nice beach if somewhat small. But the walk behind for great views the best part. Being a short walk from namely  ach

Refreshing~. Shelly beach is located at Manly. It has not many people during the day we visited. People mostly gather at Corso and beachfront there. It was refreshing to stroll around this beach with partner. We enjoyed very much here and not so crowded.

Lovely. Lots of people snorkel and scuba dive here - I regularly do the Freshwater to Shelly Beach walk and there are two great cafes along the way, it's kind of manic with walkers, runners, families, dogs - it's very Aussie
One of the best. This little beach is sheltered and protected. Great reef just off shore so its fantastic for snorkelling while protected from the surf.

A natural gem - look under the surface if you can.. Shelly Beach is located a short walk around the coast from bustling Manly beach. It's at the center of a marine reserve that has assured a rich sealife and unspoilt natural beauty. You can enjoy a rest on the clean sand, something to eat and hopefully a snorkel to be amazed by the underwater world.
Beautiful beach. It is quite literally a shelly beach. There are shells all over. It is a great place to stop for an afternoon to enjoy the beauty of Manly and pick up a few shells to take home.

Beautiful beach and coastal walk. The walk from Manly Corso to Shelley Beach is lovely, the beach is very pretty and peaceful with a fantastic restaurant as well. If you continue up the steps, the track will take you around the cliff tops to The National Park. Really worth the extra time.
So Quaint. It is a little paradise in the hectic life of Sydney and the walk there from Manly is the most relaxing and refreshing
Great little spot. Nice beach, worth the wander out from Manly. Flipflops are a must! Watch out for surf boards in the shallow water and snorklers!

One of the loveliest beaches in Syd. A marine reserve area around the corner from the famous Manly beach. Walk down the pathway from Manly and enjoy this shelly sandy stretch of beach.Perfect for snorkelling, swimming, relaxing. Lots of BBQs and grass, with travellers and locals enjoying the last of the afternoon sun. Cafe and fancy restaurant located here as well. With lots of paid parking up the stairs.Surfers can walk along the rocks to get to the Fairy Bower surf spot.A good place to start paddle boarding from.

beautiful beach. It is a pleasant walk from the ferry dock to this beach. People were snorkeling, but I did not go into the water. The best thing was the look-out and path back to Sydney through the headlands

Best place in Manly to see a sunset. Wide beach, clear water, BBQs and a coffee shop - what's not to like?! There is parking available, but it tends to fill up quickly at the weekend. It's only a short 15-20 minute walk from the Corso in Manly, and a beautiful one at that.Possibly the best place for snorkelling in Sydney, great for SUP, and if you're feeling a little more adventurous, try taking on the Bower Break.

hideaway spot near Manly. You can walk to Shelley Beach along the seaside cliff walk from Manly beach ( about 1 k) and it is bracing, beautiful and you get to Shelley Beach which is like a safe little cove away from it all and yet so close to the intensely habituated cliffs of Manly on one side and the wildness of the ocean on the other side.

Scenic beach at the end of Manly. A cute little beach, which is always crowded and fun. A short walk from Manly Beach and The Corso. A short walk up the hill leads to Spectacular Views of the Northern Beaches and North Head cliffs.

A vist to Shelley Beach is a must. You can take the regular ferry from Circular Quay to Manly beach about 30 minutes, or half that with the JetCat which costs a little more. If you're not in a hurry and want to enjoy the view, take the ferry. When the ferry docks at Manly, you will be close the Manly Aquarium, and lots of shops and restaurants. A bit of a walk to Manly beach, past lots more shops and restaurants, and often free entertainment on the promenade on the way. When you get to Manly beach at the end, you can turn right and walk toward the Lifesaver pavilion at the south end, around that and keep walking, you'll end up at Shelley beach. It is in a delightful little cove which is protected from direct ocean currents and winds, so a great place to sun and swim. There is a bit of a bush walk at the tip of it, and it you can brave that, you can take an amazing picture of almost all of Manly beach.

cute little beach. The walk to Shelly Beach is nice and it's just amazing to see how quiet it is. Unfortunately they build a new restaurant there. Now it's over with the quiet little beach... now it's constriction noise and it becomes commercialised too much... sadly.
Beautiful Quiet Beach. A beautiful, quiet beach away from tourists! A welcome respite from the crowds. Small and intimate and great for families.

shelly beach walk. What a great walk to Shelly Beach, from Manly took us around 30 minutes. A tip to keep walking up the hill behind it for some awesome views and photo opportunities. Would make a bit more time to explore around this area next time we visit.
Worth the walk. Definitely worth walking round the corner to Shelly Beach. A little smaller and prettier. Also more sheltered which has its advantages.
Great spot for watching the world go by. Nice spot away from the crowds on the main drag of Manly. Looks great for snorkelling too-I was there in July so didn't brave the water that day.

Snorkeling in Protected Preserve. The beach does have a lot of sea shells so it is hard on the feet as you go into the water. But once in the underwater world is magical. There are bathroom, changing and food facilities. It is a u-shaped beach, with trails along the top of the cliff.
Shelly Beach. it's a nice beach and there is a nice water. There are two grills that belong to hotels.It is a protected marine reserve.

alternative to manly beach. Took the ferry to Manly Beach, but wanted to snorkel, so we walked up the boardwalk to Shelly Beach. Nice and secluded with no waves like at Manly. Water was warm, but the snorkeling was average at best. Nice place to go for a swim though as most of the people at Manly were surfing and swimming areas were limited.
Great beach for BBQ and snorkeling. Huge BBQ's set up on the beach for a great family style feast. The water is also filled with coral right off the shore so bring your snorkel!

Snorkeling!. Shelly beach is a little beach well hidden on the side of Manly beach. A nice walk along the cliff, you can see water dragons on the way to Shelly beach. On a beautiful sunny day, the water looks so inviting, and at low tide the snorkeling is really extraordinary, blue groppers, pipe fish, coloured fish...don't forget your snorkel kit when you visit Shelly beach.

Beautiful spot. We hired bikes from Bonza bikes Rocks, Sydney and took them out on the ferry to Manley and found this beach at the end of the headland along a great cycle way/ promenade path. Gorgeous beach, gorgeous walk/ cycle to get there
Great walk. Walk along here after taking the ferry to Manly. Beautiful scenery with places to stop off and rest and to have a coffee.The beach has a great view back to Manly.

A day at the beach. If you'd like to get away from the waves a bit, visit Shelly Beach near Manly. It's a hidden gem. Less crowded than Manly beach itself and it's a nice walk around the cove to get there. The sand is a little rough on your feet so think about wearing sand shoes. It is really shelly...
Heaven, relax and enjoy. This is the most famous family friendly beach with the locals, a touch of paradise. Walk around from Manly and enjoy the view on the way.
Gorgeous little Beach.. We always walk around to Shelly Beach and we see lots of lizards along the walk path, gorgeous and easy stroll, do it.

Stunning spot. Went to Shelly beach for a walk and loved watching the surfers. The beach was really busy but didn't feel full at all. We sat and watched all of the comings and going. Can't wait to go back. Fab spot.

Shelly Shock. It was a nice walk around the cove from Manly, pausing at the rock swimming pool for a dip, looking up at the sweep of designer houses built into the cliffs, past the water dragons snoozing on the hot stone.However, as it was Sunday afternoon the beach itself was packed and there were a lot of families with small children. A bit of a shock after all the gorgeously empty beaches we'd been experiencing.If we'd known we would have taken snorkels, as there were lots of snorkelers. Plenty of paddle boarders too and even some people in a floating blow-up jacuzzi.It reminded us of a Mediterranean beach cove. As such it collected a bit of detritus in the water - again, we hadn't seen that before on Oz beaches.Perhaps it might have been a different experience if it had been midweek and therefore quieter. Good, safe swimming for young families. But if you don't want to elbow through the crowds in the water, if you want a peaceful spot to read or nap, it's not for you. Not on a Sunday afternoon anyway.
Visit during the week if you can (not the weekend).... Another place that is very serene and beautiful during the week, but a bit crazy at the weekend... make it a weekday if you can...
bring a bag. i could have stayed there all day. Absolutely loved the treasure. Kids and my husband had be be torn away. Also a great cafe on the walk there.
a short walk. A short walk from Manly beach and less crowded. Great for a relax during a visit to Manly. Go there just for the beach as there aren't other facilities.
Lovely swimming. A nice little cove a short walk from Manly with calmer water. Lovely for a swim.Usual drinking water available, showers, toilets and a small beach shop.
Beauty . Best beach for surfing .. Plenty of waves and clean clear water. Better then entrance. Showers are clean and loads of parking

Calm sheltered beach perfect for families. Love to snorkel here. Often see the Blue Grouper.
Loads of people of all ages playing games on the beach
Free barbies-although sometimes a wait
Restaurant currently being renovated
What a great beach!. This is a lagoon with snorkeling, scuba, and swimming. Great for families or friends to spend the day. Enjoyed watching the surfers, and taking a scenic walk on the trails.

Shelly Beach - calm and picturesque. Shelly Beach is a small sheltered area just south of Manly Beach. It is not a surfing beach as there are no waves due to its protected location. However, snorkelers and skin divers use it to view marine life.Parents with young kids tend to like this beach because it is safe. Other adults like it because it is calm and out of the way.After you enjoy your swim or sun tanning the shops, cafes and pubs in Manly are only a few minutes walk away.To get to Shelly Beach you can get the Manly ferry from Circular Quay. It is a great ride offering 40 minutes of scenic views of Sydney Harbour.Get out at Manly Wharf and walk up the Corso to the ocean beach. At the southern end of Manly Beach is a pathway leading to Shelly Beach.The pathway has small sculptures embedded in the sandstone. It also had water dragons that sun themselves and seem to pose for pictures.

Pretty beach.. Shelley Beach is such a lovely safe little beach. The walk from Manly is delightful, an easy flat walk around the bay. Very popular with all ages. A great place to snorkel with kids in the shallows. Sit on the sand and look back to busy Manly. There is a small kiosk there with another restaurant under construction.

Calm waters, bit painful on the feet. It has a grassy area up the top and a place to eat and nice sands but as the same implies, there are lots of shells, so walking into the water can be a bit painful on the feet. Once in however, there is no surf like at Manly beach and its a nice tranquil place to have a swim. There is also a rockpool for swimming on the walk up from Manly beach toward Shelly Beach.

Picnic Paradise. One of the best places on the planet for a family picnicGet there early as parking is hard.The waves are small as the beach is sheltered. It the surf is big its a great place to watch the surfers at the Fairy Bowyer.

Shelley Beach. A piece of peace.. If Manly is seven miles from sydney and a million miles from care then Shelley beach is where the locals go to get away from Manly. Shelly Beach is about a 15 minute walk from Manly surf beach that will put you in another world. Great for snorkelling or diving and just excellent if you just want to relax.
Ah, the serenity. A very pretty and fun place! Great for families, picnic, snorkelling and diving. You would be surprised as to how close the surf is to you as Shelly Beach is very calm.

Beautiful spot and sheltered. Try the walk from Manly to Shelly. It only takes about 20 minutes and the vies across the water is great. Stop and have a swim at the enclosed ocean pool along the way and then at the other end you have a choice of refreshments - take away or fine dining. Note - unless you get there very early DON'T drive to Shelly - the parking is very limited.

A very pleasant walk.. Take a walk from Manly around Cabbage Tree Bay via Marine Parade and you will be pleasantly surprised with this wonderful beach. On the way there are a couple of small cafes if you feel like a a quick snack. The beach itself contains quite a nice eating establishment but is currently closed and undergoing a rebuild.......why undertake this in the middle of the Oz summer?. Shelly is noted for the clear waters offshore and many people go there just to snorkel. It is also small enough to keep an eye on the kids and is thus ideal for a family day out. Worth a visit!

A chilled out version of Manly beach. International traveller? Not a strong swimmer in the Australian surf? Enjoy all Manly has to offer without getting washed away in a rip. Little Manly (Shelly Beach) is only a pleasant stroll from Manly Beach and has no waves. Perfect for families and a snorkel!

Jammed Early But Worth it. Loved that Shelly Beach is close to food choices and the beaches are clean and well maintained. The entire area was jammed. Several different scuba classes were in session on the beach while we sat under a great umbrella we had stashed locally. The beach is across the town area..a short walk from the Manly Ferry. This is an open ocean beach and the waves were amazing. Although we did not swim it was nice enough for experience adult swimmers to swim and younger ones to play in the shallows or short board surf. The food in the area is amazing with choices for all tastes and pocket books. Highly recommend if you visit Sydney.

Shhhh....secret perfect beach. My favourite little find on the north shore of Sydney.The walk from the manly pier along Fairy Bower to Shelly Beach alone is fabulous .there are little cafes and a great restaurant called the kiosk currently being renovated which we can't wait to try.the beach is small sandy and safe to swim. A must visit for every traveller to Sydney. See you there!

Small, but lovely. Went to explore this beach across from Manly, as suggested. Was pleasantly surprised by the sutures in rock and walk along the coast back to the Ferry Harbour - just have good walking shoes! I didn't and my feet were talking to me by the end of it! The beach itself is small, but not many people and excellent views of Manly Beach and the coast if you walk up the hill behind the beach.

A lovely spot. This is a small beach by Sydney standards and is great for non surfers! Families can wade out as the water is shallow and the beach gently slopes. There is shade and cafes a fe minutes walk along the walkway. You can walk from South Steyne, about 10 to 15 minutes or drive to one of the back streets and walk down.We like to take a picnic and while away a couple of hours.

One of my favourite beaches. Sheltered from the breaks and any rough water, Shelly provides a nice area to swim with little more than a gentle swell. On a clear day, there is a lot of sea life to see below the water. The walk around to Shelly is around the beautiful Cabbage Tree Bay.
Lovely beach. When in manly go to Shelly beach. Easy to reach from Manly external beach and on the path to Fairfax lookout.

beautiful small beach at manly. This was one of my favourite places in Sydney. It is at Manly beach but right at the end of it on the right hand side you have a long walk but it is of course worth it. The water was warm and clear to see and if you have the water camera I can recommend you take it because you will get lots of beautiful photos of the fish here. Such a beautiful beach I am really going to miss this when I have to go back home to France!

Favourite little beach in Sydney, no longer a secret spot!!. Best little beach off Manly!! Yes it can get busy on weekends, but head there mid-week bring some snorkel gear it's fantastic lots of marine life to see. Take the ferry from Circular Quay and head out to Manly really relaxed unspoilt beauty!!

A calm little bay. We started in Manly, but the waves were a little strong for a small person to swim. Decided to do the coastal walk and stumbled upon Shelly Beach. Such a huge difference! The beach was busy, but the water was calm and warm. We had a lovely swim here.
Best beach in Sydney. Best beach in Sydney! Different from Bondi, calm water, smaller beach, but beautiful!!!! Unmissable! Woth taking the ferry and the walk! Another MUST!

Bring your snorkeling gear!. Shelly beach is just amazing! you are out of the way from the busy wave breaks and you will be in the ultimate chill out beach. If you plan on visiting here then you MUST bring your snorkeling equipment. This place is a nursery for a lot of aquatic animals, you will see sting rays, giant snails, port jackson's, Grouper fish and much much more! A little tip, bring some food for yourselves as it can be quite a walk to get lunch as the beach-side bar is closed and being refurbished.

Lovely spot just up from Manly beach. A 10 minute walk along a pretty path, leads to smelly beach, a pretty little spot with a busy beach, with swimmers and snorkel lees calmer waters and a shady grass area with BBQ and toiletsA pretty walk from Manly, just turn right at the end f the Corso
good for swimming. Shelley beach is a great beach to swim. It doesn't get as crowded as the main beach, There are also trees there for shade and only I short walk from Manly beach

A pleasant walk from Manly.. This small bathing beach is a pleasant walk along the coastal pathway from Manley.A small pretty beach where one can climb to the lookout to see the Pacific.The restaurant is closed at the moment for renovations so take a drink with you as there are limited choices

Beach with no waves!. Shelly Beach is a gorgeous beach about 10 mins walk from the South End of Manly Beach. It is a lovely easy walk around to it with a cafe and a Restaurant (under renovation at present though) when you get there. There is a grass section with two electric bbqs for family picnics. It also has toilets and showers. Above Shelly Beach is a headland walk about 10 mins in duration with a stunning view north towards Palm Beach and to the south watch the surfers on the waves at the point.
Great for young family. Snorkelling is great here. However it may be a little cold. Children can enjoy the mild waves and venture off to view some sea life. Parking cost $8 per hour.
hidden secret of Sydney. A must is the ferry to Manly walk up to the end of the corso andwalk around from the surf club to this beautiful little beach.
great family beach. 10 minute walk from the bustle of Manley beach is Shelly Beach, it has a great little restaurant as well for breakfast or dinner. Good safe swimming
Great little beach. A short walk from the main beach of Manly which includes a very scenic waterside walk.A nice cliffside walk also at the top of the carpark.
Good snorkeling. Quite surprisingly, this is a really nice spot for snorkeling, almost in the center of the city. Just swim a few metres off the shore and you'll find lots of interesting fish.

A local's review. Think this beach is highly rated because it's easy to get to from the city and other places where tourists stay / visit while in Sydney. It is nothing spectacular in Sydney terms, and the snorkelling experience is a little barren from memory. If you're staying in Manly, or if you want to visit an accessible, (reasonably) unpolluted Sydney beach without surf, by all means go. If you're staying in the East and you want flat water…try visiting Nielsen Park in Vaucluse…it's a nice park and beach on the harbour - the bus goes here from the city - and there are also other things to do close by).If you want to visit the most beautiful beach in Sydney tho, seriously you need to get to Palm Beach (Summer Bay) (also PT accessible but a 1:20hr bus trip from the city). It's on a spit so you can have flat water or surf (and a round of golf) all in the one spot. And there are popular dining spots here too. Another good north side surf beach close to Manly (popular with Sydneysiders) is Freshwater. In the East, if you want to stay away from the hellish humanity overload of Bondi, or the pommy chaviness of Coogee, try Bronte (for cafes), Tamarama (for hotties) or Clovelly (for a tiny, cool, cove-like beach). For the South, I leave that to others to comment. There are a multitude of beaches in Sydney and there will be a nice one just about anywhere close to your digs. Don't be dumb and go out of your way to get to Shelly beach, it's not out of the ordinary special.

Take your snorkel. Amazing place to just take a snorkel and have a little swim. The walk there is amazing from Manly beach and is great place to swim early morning.If you don't like the waves of Manly beach then you can visit "little Europe".

Our favorite Sydney area beach. We went to several beaches while on vacation in Sydney and this was the best one. Its a smaller beach but the walk there from Manly is beyond words. Every corner turn reveals a new view. The beach itself is full of small tiny shells that make up sand. I have never seen sand like this before and it was nice to see something new. The water was great with no waves so we could actually swim without having to be pushed around by giant waves which is what happened in all the larger beaches we went to. I would highly recommend this place.

Popular beach on Manley Island. It came as a surprise to our friends how popular this beach has become. They've installed public barbecues too so it attracts families and boy, did it! It was very crowded, so much so that we couldn't get near the sea!Still, it's a very pretty spot and worth the walk around. Nice ferry ride from Circular Key too, worth it just for that!
Nice. Beautiful little beach with great views back across to ManlyCan be busy though but well worth the tripCafe being rebuilt now so take food and drinks with you

Manly to Shelly walk and beyond. Not someone who really enjoys sitting on a beach or swimming, this walk and the pretty little beach at the end of it was well worth the ferry from Sydney. We took the path round the headland and managed to spot dolphins then enjoyed dodging the breaking surf as we made our way back to Many.
Beautiful. A lovely walk along Manly Beach to Shelly Beach. Lots of bits of art and installations along with way. A little cute cove and great beach for small children. Really clean and safe.

Nice sheltered beach. Great place to walk to via the Manly beach front. Parking is minimal but its a lovely walk. Its sheltered so there are only tiny waves and there is a restaurant and kiosk but they are pretty expensive.Nice small beach pool is off the walkway with public toilets available. If your visiting Manly this is a good place to stroll to

Secret beach of Sydney. This is a great place to spend the evening. Kids have lots of safe a secluded place to play. Adults may rest on the beach or in the close by park. Places to eat are just a couple steps away.

Gets packed. We ended the Manly/Shelly scenic walk here, as did several hundred others. Not a large beach, but, we found enough space to set our stuff down without being on top of another group. It's a small cove so the waves are calm. Oh yeah, there's a ton of shells - hence the name.

Well worth the walk from Manly beach. A lovely secluded little beach about half a mile along the pathway running by the seashore.However, if you are looking for some nourishment at the end of your walk the only place currently available by the beach is a mobile takeaway coffee bar as the nearby restaurant/cafe/shop is undergoing major resoration and it looks like it will be several months before it is operational again. There is however drinking water available from the drink stations close to the barbecue area.There is also a shop halfway along from Manly to Shelly and a cafe/restaurant for those wishing to eat. I have not actually eaten there but it looks a bit price for my modest budget!

Nice place for snorkelling. Nice family beach without big ocean waves. Was snorkelling 50 meters from beach and there were lots of large fish. Nearby parking in very limited and is quite expensive ($16 per day)Here is underwater video taken on that beach. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s1Ybza3Zhnc

nice walk along the ocean edge. its a great walk to do and also a bike path on non busy days which is also good there is a coffee shop at the end and also one halfway along. shelly beach is great for snorkelling and very clean we mainly go there just for the walk really if you're spending the day in Manly a walk up to shelley beach and back is a good inclusion personally I wouldn't go there on a busy day if you have the choice, but I suppose for a tourist its a must do enjoy

Another great beach. I came here for some of the best local Scuba Diving around without hitting the Great Barrier Reef. Beach is lovely. Sculptures embedded in the stones around. Natural beautiful plants and lizards are about and are protected. Great for snorkling as well.

Scenic beach, away from the Manly crowds. We loved this beach. It is a short walk from Manly beach but has a very different flavor since it is less crowded and more intimate. We swam at this beach and wanted to stay longer.

Quieter than Many and very different. The walk itself from Manly to Shelly is excellent, being well surfaced, and some excellent sculptures embedded in the retaining wall. The cafe is being extensively rebuilt. The diving and snorkeling look good but not for me. Try the walk from Shelly to North head - a good view.

Has it all. Great snorkelling. Beautiful walk. Excellent cafe.. SHely beach is one of my favourite places for a weekday outing. The snorkelling is beautiful. Join the Bold & Beauitful swim club at dawn each morning to swim from Manly to Shelly and back and take in the sea life along the way.Stroll to Shelly and look out for Fairy Penguins and the occasional dolphin or whale.The Boatshed Cafe is a must visit as is The Bower Cafe at Fairy Bower.

Must go from Manly!. Tiny beach just a beautiful walk from Manly, this beach is a snorkelers heaven! Just below the surface you can see a wide variety of fish and plants here. We did the scuba and at just 3-4 mts we were able to spot a lot of fish. Quiet beach for bbq with friends and just relax.

Best place on earth. Paradise. Swim with dolphins, baby dusky whalers (non-threatening sharks), giant cuttlefish, all manner of fish and sea life. Clean protected waters. Superb for snorkelling and scuba diving. Safe for kids. Spectacularly beautiful setting. Great views. Free BBQ facilities. The walk between Manly Beach and Shelly Beach around Cabbage Tree Bay, is divine. Dozens of water dragon lizards. Sculptures. A couple of good little cafes/restaurants. Happy people. Perfect.

Just great!. Amazing place, amazing view.
This beach and area around are stunning and worth to visit!
Great to walk by the rocks, by the beach and green area around! A must to go!

Excellent place with good vibes. We arrived there quite randomly after a walk and we fond the cutest little spot ever, full of people that were enjoying a nice evening, putting lights and music, performing arts like flamed sticks and diabolo, that was like an improvised party on the beach, where everyone joined and spent good time together, that to do!
Lovely walk. A lovely coastal walk from Manly beach and quite sheltered though the beach is coarser sand than Manly beach.

A great place for a BBQ. Shelly Beach is my favourite beach in Sydney. It's not the best swimming, surfing, or even snorkelling beach - but it stands out among Sydney's many good beaches because it's quiet, sheltered, and an ideal place to bring family or friends for an all day BBQ.The water is calm enough for kids to enjoy, and there's ample space for ball games or picnics underneath the shady trees.The walk from Manly Beach to Shelly is quite scenic as well.
Great small beach!. Can get very crowded. Great Dive & snorkel spot. Good for young kids. Wish the eatery would hurry and open! Outdoor showers and nice enough bathrooms close by. Picnic tables.

Explore the Shelly Beach by bike!. Why don´t you explore Manly and the Shelly Beach by bike? It´s fun! Right opposite the Manly visitor center you can get bikes and helmets quite cheap. Even our 5-year-old enjoyed it a lot. At the end of our tour we went swimming at the Shelly Beach - terrific!

Beautiful city beach. Shelley Beach is a great getaway from the hustle & bustle of other major tourist beaches in Sydney (Bondi, Manly, Coogee). A hidden gem great for relaxing, and if you're more adventurous, snorkling in the marine reserve area. A short walk from the Manly Surf Club!

Lovely, small beach in Manly. Take the ferry to Manly, walk down the Corso to the ocean beach area and then turn right to walk towards Shelly Beach. Its a short (12-15 minute) walk with great views, fantastic rock pools to look at and some interesting art work and sculptures. Shelly Beach itself is small but very attractive. Its a place to sit and reflect and enjoy the sand. There are no cafes on Shelly Beach at the moment although there is some building work which suggests that one mght be on the way.
Beautiful little beach. It is cute, now wind, no waves, clear water. Getting very busy on weekends. Go there early and get a barbecue and spend all day there.

A little gem but no cafe anymore. This is a lovely little beach around the corner from the main Manly beach (just follow the coast path from Manly round to the right). The beach is sheltered from the winds you often get on Manly and the rocky shores make it great for snorkelling and swimming. There was no café when we visited (Nov '14), it looked like it was being refurbished so take some snacks around with you.

Beutiful. From manly take the walk to Shelly Beach, an easy walk for both able bodied and those less so. Look out for the Water Dragon's, lovely little sea lizards and the works of art along the route. The beach itself is lovely and the water area has been preserved by allowing no fishing so the snorkelling and diving are excellent. Thee is a small cafe, toilets are clean and plenty of picnic areas. Enjoy

Great treasure at the end of Manly Scenic Walk. You will find this tiny little beach at the end of the Manly Scenic Walk. Nice place to rest and swim - on your way to Shelly Beach try to find some the rare water dragons!

It's a beach. Unsure what the hype is about this beach??? We walked from Manly and enjoyed the walk but when we got to Shelly Beach there was nothing there? A building that may have been a cafe was possibly being demolished. The grass & BBQ area was closed off and the beach itself was sharp sand, dirty with remains of bbq's. All in all a bitter disappointment. Much better beaches around Sydney

Walk to Shelly Beach. We took a ferry to check out Manly Beach and everyone told us to take the walk to Shelly Beach, so that's what we did and I am so glad we did. It's sort of off the beaten path, if you will, so it's not so crowded. It's really a lovely beach and the water is nice and calm (although there seem to be a lot of jellyfish, but nobody cared, just freaked us out). This is a must if you take the ferry to Manly Beach! The ferry drops you right there by 2 beaches (Manly Cove), but just walk straight back (down the street opposite of where the ferry drops you) and you'll find the very large Manly Beach, take a right and walk along the Marine Parade and you'll see Shelly Beach, it's gorgeous!

In love with it!. I'm in love with the whole Manly quarter that includes Shelly Beach as well!. I love the small walk from Manly beach to Shelly beach. I love the yellow sand there, the shallow waters, the genuine tree shades... I love that it's small, way smaller in comparison to Manly and feels more cozy! You should definitely go there for a swim!

great for sunsets, clear water, but a little crowded. in my opinion the best coastal walk in sydney with a buggy. wide and paved all the way from manly to shelly, there are cafes along the way. great place for an evening sunset bbq.there are four bbqs at the back of the beach, all free of charge, but it can get pretty busy at times. there is parking above the back of the beach for those with a car, but it's easily walkable from manly if on foot.an aquatic reserve, there is the bower break for surfers and some of the clearest water around the harbour for snorkelers and divers alike.
Gracefull Place. So beautiful, very relaxing, great on a sunny afternoon for a picnic i like the later part of the day as less people

Epic Surf and Sand. If you can manage to get here on the weekdays, when the crowds are not there - this is one of the best beaches in Sydney. This protected cove allows for the peace-seeker to relax on the sand and waveless ocean. But the headland also packs a punch in that the surfbreak here can be the place to come when the surf is huge. Dangerous rocks underneath and one boulder in particular "Seirge" as it is called, is right in the middle of the wave as it moves from left to right. This feels secluded, but it has everything. And your about a 10 minute walk to Manly which has it all. Dont park here, too expensive and they will book you.

Walking from Manly Beach to Shelly Beach. As I grew up in Manly I am very familiar with the walk to Shelly Beach but it is unwise to go early in the morning. This is such a lovely time of day but there are throngs of people doing this walk with battalions of young mums with those big baby pushers. It is much more enjoyable in the afternoon and early evening. Perfect if you are actually staying in Manly. There are plenty of restaurants along the beachfront to choose from for a pleasant dinner.
Favorite beach. Great beach for shell lovers and swimmers. Food at nearby cafe was good. Just a gorgeous spot to spend the day. Wish I could go back now.
Love this walk!. From Circular Quay catch the ferry to Manly. Walk through the Esplanade out to Manly Beach then turn right. Walk along the foreshore until you get to the lovely little Shelley Beach.

Not spectacular. This beach has been a bit over hyped. It really isn't that pretty or beautiful. The walk to it again is not that special and if it rains you can't swim for over twenty four hours in it due to pollution from a very large sewerage pipe. You won't miss much by not visiting it.

Great little beach. Shelly Beach is tucked away at the far right of Manly Beach. It's a great walk along the promenade and foreshore to Shelly where you are likely to pass Water Dragons sunning themselves on the grass. The beach has a good kiosk for refreshment and bbq etc for picnics. Great calm beach for the kids and good, interesting snorkelling as its on a marine park. At low tide we like to scramble over the rocks and around the headland where you probably won't even bump into another person until you get back up to the car park.

Fun beach. The walk from manly to shelly beach is something that I would recommend everyone. With various snorkelling points and small cafes it's a great work out walk or a leisurely stroll. Shelly beach has a high school party feel all the time with community barbecues and young crowd. It's a perfect place for a fun party
snorkellers delight. A gorgeous little beach around the corner from bustling Manly. Very popular with divers, snorkelers, swimmers and picnickers. A perfect spot to enjoy a sunny afternoon.
Very cute beach. I went here a few times. Its a great little beach and if you are lucky you may see dolphins swimming close by. Also a good spot for snorkelling.
Great for old and young alike. Sheltered beach at Cabbage Tree Bay with safe bathing for all. Very popular for scuba divers and surfers.

Beautiful Calm Beach.. A beautiful small beach. One of my favourite walks ( especially on a sunny morning) is walking from Queenscliff, along Manly Beach to Shelly Beach- then jump into the water! Bliss!

Shelly Cleaner now since the Murk turned off. My first dive at Manly's Shelly Beach in 10 years with my bud Salvo and found it a lot cleaner now that the old northern sewer tunnel takes Sydney's mess 3 ks out to sea. Great vis on the day and were lucky enough to see a couple of big rays and a bronze whaler.Unfortunately one of the many dive groups we saw on the day were chasing a leafy sea dragon around trying to get photos and were turning over rocks everywhere. The fish will come back now that the sewer has stopped so its well worth a look.

A relaxed part of Sydney.... Shelley beach is a gorgeous beach just a short walk from manly. Unlike manly it is not overly crowded and isn't a surf beach, it is a nice relaxed 'Shelly' beach! Close nearby there are rocks to explore. I would recommend it for locals wanting to relax with some friends.
Heavenly. What a great little beach a good 15 minutes away from the bustle of Manly. Its protected, with great swimming and snorkelling plus a neat little bar and restaurant.

Great for an easy snorkel off the beach. Shelly Beach is so cute and just 10 min walk around the scenic walk from Manly. Sun bake on the beach, have an easy snorkel off the beach..eat at the cute restaurant and wander back to Manly. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful beach, safe swimming and sheltered. A short walk from Manly, this beach is worth visiting. It's peaceful and sheltered from the wind off the sea that prevails on Manly Beach. The sand is just wonderful and the beach was not crowded. The walk to it is fairly flat and you pass tea rooms on the way whilst you take in the scenery. The seagulls that plague Manly didn't seem to affect Shelly Beach and people were eating picnics without being mobbed by birds.The Water Dragons were out in number and they are great to see in their natural environment. This is just a lovely place and well worth the walk.

Shelly Beach. Very nice Sydney beach - visited in 2003 nor 2013, but that option wasn't available - but very good bars, cafés and restaurants to enjoy in quite a chilled beach location, away from the madness of Manly/Bondi or Coogee

Don't miss the water dragons. Ferry out from Circular key, fish and chips sitting by the sea (watch out for the seagulls) and the stroll along to Shelly Beach and back, watch out for the water dragons.
So so pretty. Just have to say that this one is probably my favourite in Sydney. So do yourself a favour and have a look for yourself. You'll see what i mean and fall in love.
lovely. Shelly beach was quite a different experience for me... the cold and clear water made me feel like being at a lake more than at the beach.... lovely place to spend the day

My fav secret beach. Take a walk along the seaside path from Manly, or even Queenscliff for that matter , past the bust Fairy Bower and onto Shelly Beach. With A World Class Restaurant Le Kiosk or the more casual Cafe next door you can dine and enjoy a beverage or take your picnic basket and make use of the bar-b-ques provided for a good old Aussie Sausage Sizzzle. Divers meet her to take classes and families enjoy the sand and gentle cove waters for the littlies to paddle and snorkel and swim. The coastal walk is just mesmerising as you can watch the enthusiastic surfers tackle the surf from the break further out. The view back to Manly is magnificent. Catch a ferry from Circular Quay and enjoy one of Sydneys most beautiful spots

One of my favs in Sydney. Pretty little beach 5 minutes walking from bus stops or Manly ferry. Really really nice, you can rent a stand up paddle and enjoy the nature along the Manly Beach or walk up to the mountains. Reccomend.

Nice Walk. take the walk along the rocky shoreline from Manly to Shelly Beach. The pathway is wide and not at all strenuous. You will pass by some beautiful scenery and look out for the water dragons (lizards) basking in the sunshine. This is one of the best spots to view the Manly seaside and surrounds. A great favourite and one of those places you just want to tell someone about.

The boathouse to open at Shelly Beach. The Boathouse at Balmoral Beach and Palm beach offer fabulous meals and relaxed and stylish environment. Children can play on the beach within site. Now they will open at Shelly Beach, cant wait!
best snorkelling in Sydney. This beach definitely has the best snorkelling in the Sydney area. Plenty of marine life. See something different everytime.

my favourite beach walk. Start off from esplanade, and walk round to Shelly. Swim in the marine reserve on the way round, and just soak up the views and the laidback lifestyle. Doesn't get any better than this!
over used. A bit dirty, maybe under construction, but a lot of rubbish. Compared to the rest of the trail and Manly Beach this seems to be ignored.
shelly beach beautiful at sunset. shelly beach is a peaceful little beach as lovely water cliff walks good paths and is sheltered from the wind and it is not to far to walk to manly beach

Quiet little beach with beautiful sunset views.. Spontaneously found this little beach with a few friends one afternoon. It's definitely a more peaceful option if you decide to walk up from Manly beach. Sunset views were also very beautiful. Would come back again to use the outdoor bbq facilities.

Sheltered beach a short walk from Manly Beach. There is a lovely scenic walk from Manly Beach to Shelly Beach which hugs the cliffs and gives great views of Manly Beach and Queenscliff. It is a tarmacked path and is sheltered from the cold southerly winds, as is Shelly Beach. Both are sun traps which is good when its cold. The Beach is gently slopping and very protected from waves and currents so is great for kids to play safely. A 15 minute stroll from Manly Beach. You can even buy drinks and food there.
Simply stunning. Oh what a lovely little place! Nice and secluded, even though it's winter still lovely to walk on,have a note to eat or just sit and watch the waves

Snorkeling Supreme. If you are a diver or just like to sunbake then Shelly Beach is the place to be no matter what time of year. It is a popular destination for locals and for this reason you will very rarely be alone but if you will see less people in winter (for obvious reasons).Diving is good all year round. Rays, sharks, huge range of fish, sea stars, sea jellies (seasonal), urchins, sea horses, octopus and cuttle fish can all be found here by swimmers and divers a like. If you want a beautiful destination along a coastal walk or a destination for a dive/swim Shelly is definitely a location you should add into your next Manly visit.Shelly Beach is on the far side of Manly over the ridge but can be accessed after a 15-20minute walk from the Manly Ferry Terminal.
Enjoy the walk from Manly Beach to Shelly Beach. Wonderful walk along the marked pathway from the Manly Surf Club in the southern corner of Manly Beach.

Beautiful. You can keep the Caribbean when you have such an idyllic beach as this one .. Pretty little community of a beach , houses restaurants lots of Flora & Fauna & safe snorkeling & swimming Idyllic

A Hidden Gem. This little beach is a short, beautiful and easy walk from Manly. It is sheltered and without waves. Wonderful for a picnic or a swim.
Absolutely beautiful.

Great scenic easy walk to and from Manly. Shelly Beach is a great sheltered beach with great outlook to Manly Beach. Also great easy walk to and from Manly with cafes and kiosks. Nice grassy area for picnics, BBQ and can easily be walked from Manly wharf about 2 kilometers away or car parking available at the top of the picnic area. Not suitable for surf. Many joggers and walkers use this path to and from Manly as it is a great view that you can see up to Palm Beach on a clear day.
Gem in the suburbs. A sheltered spot for picnics, or sunbathing, or just to watch the sunset...an easy walk from Manly ferry...will not disappoint!
Wonderful beach. Perfect for swimming or snorkelling. Convenient with young children. Not suitable for surf. Restaurant, café and take away food available.

A Day at Shelly Beach Manly. A beautiful spot for diving, swimming and BBQ with friends and family. If you walk up the stairs you have a two lookouts to look out on the sea. On a clean day you can see Palm Beach with help of binoculars.

A Hidden Gem. Considering this is a short scenic walk from Manly you feel like you are a world a way at Shelly Beach. The water is clear, it's great for snorkelling and of course swimming to from Manly and back for exercise. On a calm day this beach is safe for children. Make sure you walk around the Shelly Headland for great views where I was fortunate to see a whale frolicking in the distance! This beach really is a hidden gem.

would rate it 3 and a half if I could. Shelly Beach is just a beach near Manly (which is an attractive area with lots of shops and restaurants. The walk to Shelly Beach along the water is nice. We have done it twice. The first time we actually saw a water dragon in the shrubbery on the side of the path! The second time we walked all the way to the cliffs above Shelly and saw a whale right off the coast--it actually came into Manly Bay! There is also the opportunity to scuba dive, snorkel and paddle board there. Not great but nice.
Mediterranean has nothing on this place. The best beach in Sydney ocean, protected and easily accessed. Clear waters all year around. Dive, snorkel, tan all day.

Relaxing beach!. Shelly is a short 10 minute walk from manly beach but is a definite must see! The beach itself is small but offers a lot of views and shells/ sea glass to collect while there. There is also stairs that lead to a breathtaking look out if you are up for seeing views of manly!

great snorkling beach. Shelly Beach is an amazing beach for snorkeling. I visited the beach while on holiday and found all manner of fish under the water. Take some equipment and swim from fairy bower.

Crystal clear water and dolphins!!. On a walk round to Shelly Bay we could see scuba divers walking into the sea from the pebbled beach. As we stopped to turn and walk back we noticed dolphins playing not far from the shore. It was lovely to see them in the wild.

Scenic!. This is an easy walk from Manly along the coast . The water is crystal clear and you can swim in the pool halfway around or at Shelley Beach which has tiny waves. There is a coffe shop and a cafe part way around or the Kiosk at shelley Beach. The northern beaches is a great part of the world and is far superior to Bondi and the eastern suburbs beaches.
Scenic beach. Small but scenic beach. Clear water and white sand with various palm-trees around. Better bring some beach tent with you.
Perfect little hideaway. Walked along from Manly to Shelly Beach in beautiful weather. Quiet little cove but I'm sure it would be packed in Summer. Very scenic and safe for swimming.

Scenic short easy walk or cycle. Easy pathway from Manly to Shelley Beach along the ocean coastline is fabulous for strollers, bicycles, dog walkers and walker/ jiggers alike. The Kiosk at Shelley Beach is great for a meal or coffee or cool drink.

Beautiful, Scenic, Great Snorkeling and Scuba Diving. We walked over to Shelly Beach from Manly Beach. A short 20 minute walk along the beach takes you past the lifeguard station, a couple of cafes, some scenic artwork, benches and sitting areas, etc.Once on Shelly Beach, the view of Manly Beach is beautiful. Shelly Beach is a protected cove, and is very picturesque. There you will find many snorkelers, scuba divers, and you can easily see Wobbegong Sharks, and Cuttle fish. The diving is shallow (20 feet or less), and you can get a lot of bottom time. The local dive shop will bring out gear if needed, and even provide a lunch.Simply a nice peaceful area that many tourists walk to, but don't spend any time.
Peaceful and pretty. We had a beautiful sunny day to see the beach and walk along the sea shore. We also went up the cliff above the beach for beautiful views. Highly recommended!

Well Worth a Short Walk. A short walk from the southern end of Manly Beach is an idyllic beach with crystal clear water. It is extremely safe for small children but if you continue a little further you will come to Fairy Bower on the point. This point has a renowned surf break when the wind is offshore. There is a fabulous restaurant on Shelly Beach. Access is also available via motor vehicle but the walk is special

wow wow. This is a must see little cove. Beautiful and clear clean water. Lovely walk up to the cliffes. Cafe was under renovation at the time, but a coffee cart was set up. Easy walk from Manly Beach.
Perfect for small children. If you have children who are of a young age Shelley beach is the place to be. Not a large beach, but great for the youngest as you don't get the huge waves.

Pretty lil beach. Pretty beach next to Manly beach. There's a little walk from one to the other and is well worth a visit. Beautiful views and very calm, not to crowded, was winter though. Still nice despite the wind and cold.

Amazing walk, incredibly beautiful!. The view was spectacular! It is an easy and quick walk to Shelly Beach and it is so worth it! The sand is gorgeous and you can collect seashells as well as sea glass on the beach. It gets the last rays of sunlight for the day so it's a gorgeous spot to go and watch the sunset. Highly recommend.

Amazing. Shelly Beach is protected from the ocean swell by the reef that lies on the right hand side of the beach (when facing the ocean) and faces west. free electric barbecues, showers, toilets and a kiosk selling meals, drinks and ice cream. There is a restaurant on the beach called Le Kiosk. There is a bush track around the headland offering spectacular views of the Northern Beaches and North Head. The facilities also include parking at the rate of $8.00 an hour.

Beautiful spot for a day trip from the city. I was in Sydney for business but took a break one of the days to go to Shelly beach and manly and I wasn´t dissapointed. Beautiful spot. I went on a week day so it wasn´t very crowded. And bought a sándwich in a Little café next to the beach.

A little beauty. A short walk from Manly beach along the Manly Scenic Walkway this small beach is just the little gem you hope to stumble upon in Australia. It even has public BBQ's available to enjoy lunch on the beach!

Most beautiful beach in Sydney. A lovely little beach just a few minutes walk from manly beach. It lays in a little bay which makes the sea really peaceful and a great, safe place to swim. Apparently also a good place to snorkel. Buy some meat and have a great barbeque at one of the free hot barbeque plates. Definitely my favorite beach
Great place to snorkel. Easy snorkelling right off the beach heaps of fish. Dry off and chill on the beach or grab some fantastic food from one of the great cafés best early morning

Sheltered bay within reach of busy Manly. A lovely little walk along the coast from Manly to Shelly (less than 10min amble) with a number of options to stop and enjoy coffee/cake en-route. Beach offers sheltered swimming tho drops away quite quickly if with children. Nice grass area to relax at with a coffee shop and restaurant to resupply at if so desired.

Relaxing. This beach was recommended to me by a family member living in Manly. The sea is lovely and clear, and it is a perfect little sun-trap for a good relax.There are barbeques there, so I found it a great place to eat lunch. But be warned - there are birds who take all sorts of chances to take your burgers from you! Me and my sister were taking a self-timer photograph at the BBQ, only to find a kokuboro swoop down and steal my burger!!Apart from the traumatic lunch experience, this place is definitely one to visit.
Great snorkling spot. I love the easy access to this wonderful experience. It does get a bit crowded with tourists. Overall very good - go out on the right to view groupers

One of my favorite places around Sydney. Amazing spot for friends and family. Cabbage Tree Bay just right there on Shelly is a "no-take aquatic reserve" - full of marine life with easy access to great to snorkel.
Unfortunately some people spoiled the place disturbing the marine life and disrespecting the "no-take" policy. I can only hope it remains a protected area...some people take it for granted!

great spot in Manly for the late sun. A beautiful little cove just on the other side of Manly beach. Leave the tourists and take the walk around to Shelley - about 20 min walk around the water. Pass by the crystal clear water and a marine park. Take a dip in the calm waters before visiting one of the cafes on your walk back.

Great Snorkeling. If you are a good swimmer, this is a great place to snorkel. Plan on a wetsuit in the winter months. Saw the biggest Cuttlefish I have ever seen...more than 3 feet long. One reef shark. Located near Manly Beach and a great scenic walk.

Awesome spot. Snorkelled here and also walked here from Manly after getting Ferry.Lovely protected small beach and also nice spot for a snack or meal.A must for visitors or for a walk.Look out for lizards.

A secluded beach an easy walk from Manly. Go to the southern end of Manly surf beach and keep walking south hugging the coast. A pleasant 20 minute stroll and you reach Shelley Beach. It's secluded so doesn't have waves. Great if you have small children. It's usually fairly quiet. A great place for a picnic or there are some nice eating places.

Beautiful walk. I took the ferry from Sydney Harbor to Manly and then walked over to Shelly and up through the cliff area. It was beautiful. The views were breathtaking. I found a lookout point where no one was at the moment and it was so peaceful to just stand there looking out over the sparkling sea. Highly recommend on a nice day! It was truly beautiful!

Shelly Beach. Shelly Beach is a lovely, sheltered beach, just a short walk from Manly Beach. Where Manly Beach was pretty windy, Shelly Beach was calm with no wind at all. Spend a really nice and easy day here.Even saw some big rays, that came really close to the beach. And I wasn't even snorkeling.

Great little hideaway, good for snorkelling. Love this little beach. It's a fair walk from Manly ferry but well worth the trek to get into a little paradise of nice with a mix of couples, families and singles.

a small & special stretch of shoreline . . . like a secret garden. A pleasant walking path takes you from the long white sandy Manly beach to the small, sheltered, golden sands of Shelly Beach. Discovering it is like finding a secret garden in a big arboretum. It is a simple place to build sandcastles and swim (particularly if you favor calm waters over waves). There are easy trails up to the cliffs that offer spectacular views of the ocean and back to Manly as well. Take your time.

Walk to this Beauty regularly. Beautiful little sheltered beach in Manly. Go have a look and soak up the rays. You might even see a few underwater too if you are into Scuba Diving it is a marine park. Snorkeling is good too.

Cute beach. I came across this little beach completely randomly as we decided to do a walk from manly beach. What a lovely surprise to find this little sheltered beach. The water was very calm, the sun facing the beach. It wasn't too crowded either. Not your typical Australian beach.

Perfect family beach. This beach is perfect for families as it's smaller and quite secluded. The sea is much calmer. There are some toilet facilities which are not brill but we were certainly very thankful for them! Would highly recommend giving this beach a look.
Beautiful. Great walk to Shelly Beach, which on the day was popular for a swim because of wild surf. Pity the restaurant nearby was closed
Shelly Beach for fish. This small beach which faces north is pretty and sits facing Manly and is enclosed by bush. Good spot to snorkel. Walk from Manly very easy and takes about 10 mins or less.

This place is awesome. Check it out.. One of my favorite beaches in Sydney. If you have the time, do the walk from Manly Beach. It's a beautiful stroll and you can even take a dip in the sea pool on the way.

So close to Manly. A short walk along a path from Manly brings you to Shelly Beach, one of the only westerly facing beaches in NSW.
Safe bathing, calm waters, lovely beach backed by palm trees (a great place to get married .... I did!!) and a good cafe next to the beach

Amateur snorkelling on Manly's doorstep. If you haven't snorkelled before then this is a good place to try your hand at it. Shelly is quieter than Manly and due to the natural bay the water is usually calm.We rented flippers and snorkels at a nearby shop and spent hours in the water looking at the marine fauna. Initially, snorkelling made me feel panicky (something about constantly hearing your breathe rattle and wheeze down a small plastic pipe), but after a while it's just fun!Australia's wildlife is normal wildlife on steroids - so many fish in different shapes, sizes and colours. We even saw stingrays! Check out the info board at the entrance and see if you can get the species on their hitlist.PRO-TIP: It goes without saying that you're putting on suncream in Australia, but be extra careful when snorkelling. Your back is constantly exposed to the sun, so make sure you reapply every hour - or you'll burn like I did!

Brilliant beginner's snorkeling spot. Definitely the place to go to for snorkeling if you're a beginner.Really calm water Despite the lack of parking, you can easily catch a ferry to Manly and walk over to this little beach

Special Spot. Great little beach reached by a scenic walk from Manly.We usually visit each time we are in Sydney. My husband and son enjoy snorkelling there as it is a marine reserve.We have special memories as my son and daughter in law were married there.

Beautiful quiet beach. Half an hour on the ferry from Sydney, 10 min walk to Manly beach and then a pleasant 20min stroll to Shelly beach. Gently sloping, sandy, peaceful, nearby facilities and refreshments, in contrast to the busier more commercialised Manly beach. Play area for children, and good swimming and snorkelling for adults. Sheltered from prevailing wind, a veritable sun-trap.

Good place to chill and snorkel. Bring your snorkelling gear, thats what everyone does there. There are juvenile snapper and i saw some cuttle fish as well as quite a few wrasse and mullet. There is a break there to surf as well. Make sure to walk to manly from there, its well worth it.

Best snorkeling in sydney. Well worth making the trip over the bridge! Lovely little beach away from main drag of manly beach. My absolute fave place to snorkel in Sydney. Beautiful. No surf either so great for kids or those a little nervous in surf. Great bbq area at back if fancy it in summer and handy little cafe too (can also get a beer here). Lovely local restaurant le kiosk also based here. Worth a visit.

Love Shelly Beach. I love going to Shelly Beach for my morning swim as it is so quiet and peaceful. The snorkling off Shelly Beach is amazing as it is so protected being the only beach that faces westward on the Eastcoast. If you walk up to the headland above you will get some amazing photo's of Manly and Shelly.

Just a great short walk. The walk from Manly to Shelly Beach is something that every visitor to Sydney should do. It is just beautiful. The swimming at both Manly and Shelley Beach is superb and the snorkeling at Shelly is wonderful. Don't miss the views from the headland east of Shelly Beach where there are great views north to Gosford and beyond. It is about a 3.5km return trip from the ferry wharf via The Corso and Manly surf club, I would allow a couple of hours at least as there is plenty to see and do.

Nice cool private place. Wonderfully location small beach , about 10 mins walk from Manly along the coastline . The bush walk is good and the waters are so calm, ideal for a lazy afternoon swim. Almost feels you are in a swimming pool !!!

Worth the walk!. Situated a short walk along the beach from Manly this is a lovely little beach but can get quite crowded at times with snorklers and surfers so best to visit outside of the main holiday times.There are a couple of cafes/restaurants adjacent to the beach but they can be a bit pricey. There are also 2 free barbeques for public use if you fancy dining Al Fresco!

Lovely beach and views. Shelly Beach is a very pretty and sheltered beach. It looks back towards Manly. There are public toilets and a take away cafe. Becomes very crowded weekends.There are great walks up along the cliff tops with fabulous views out to sea.

Beautiful beach, great for friends/family day at the beach and BBQ. Shelly Beach is beautiful, great swimming, has a few nice cafes/restaurants around, has a great BBQ area so you can spend the whole day with friend and family.Its only a little walk around to Manly, which is a lovely walk and you can stop and enjoy the little rock pools along the way.

Dare I say ' best beach '. The sand beneath your feet is breath taking. Stepping into the water to have little fish nibble at your feet and legs is a laugh. The clear water, the wonderful walkway, not crowded beach, little restaurants and the town near by with free filtered water stations all over to fill your water containers - amazing!! Must go to Manly and head to Shelly Beach.

it's a beach. Not much to say as it is on the walk recommended in all the guide books, it was busy and picturesque. It does have toilets, changing areas a cafe and restaurant. Also a free filtered water fountain to refill your water bottle. Look out for the cunning little sculptures all along the walk.

Beautiful beach!. Amazing! It is a great relaxing spot for those who want peaceful waves, a kiosk beside it for a quick brunch or dinner (Is quite moderately priced ($15+) nonetheless a close romantic getaway for any couple.A place you find along the outskirts as you walk along the path at Manly Beach, it has a lot of seashells, and a small little forest you can walk through and discover great amazing views, one of the top locations for snorkeling recently someone even spotted a dolphin and was playing with it!

Manly's Shelly Beach. Shelly Beach is absolutely beautiful! I went to Manly for the day and looked up things to do and found a website ( www.hellomanly.com.au ) of what's in Manly. There in the fun facts page I saw a bit on Shelly Beach and how the sunsets are perfect at Shelly and decided to check it out. Shelly Beach is a wonderful, smaller beach with wildlife surrounding it as well as cute boutiques and a cafe on your walk over there. I also saw 3 water dragons running about! It was a fantastic time and would recommend all to spend a day at Shelly Beach in Manly!

Fish galore, gropers, sea horses and even little dusky whaler sharks. I don't know which Shelley Beach the previous reviewer went to but it's definitely not the one I've been to dozens of times. It's our first stop with any interstate or overseas visitors. It's often crowded but never spoils the fun

Our favourite beach in Sydney. Shelly Beach is perfect for swimming, snorkeling, and enjoying wildlife. The water is calm and still quite warm. We spent an afternoon with our little grandchildren playing in the water and on the sand, and watched crabs duck under the rocks and a water dragon sun itself on a huge boulder. Sea gulls and two kookaburras calling overhead completed the picture. There is a lovely walkway along the sea from Manly to Shelly which is perfect for ocean views and finding more water dragons.

Wonderful family beach. This beach has it all for young and old alike. Across from the rolling surf(ers) of Manly beach, it is more placid. Soft sand and rocks for kids to climb on, excellent snorkelling and good diving for beginners. ( the local dive schools use it). The cafe is very good, although currently up for tender with plans to extend.
perfect. short easy walk from manly - perfect for swimming as no vicious rip tides - beach is shells- quieter than manly with trees clifs and walks- has a resteraunt but BYO aussie style is better

Secluded beach with calm waters. Walk all the way to the end of Manly Beach and continue walking until you get to Shelly Beach. It is a cove that is isolated from the breaking waves of the main beach and allows you to enjoy a swim in calm, warm waters without battling breaking waves. If you want to body surf and enjoy invigorating waves, go to the main beach and swim between the flags. For a calmer salt water dip, enjoy Shelly Beach plus it's a pleasant walk to get there and along the way you might get a glimpse of some living water dragons that reside in the cliff walls.
Beautiful hideaway. Beautiful place, water was very clean,would certainly recommendGreat shaded areas nice little restaurant close byGreat place to sunbake

Amazing snorkelling and away from hectic Manly!. Absolutely amazing Snorkelling.... saw everything from Groper to crabs to porcupine fish to puffer fish to Clownfish...Really clear water and sheltered, you felt safe and protected and people were happy to keep an eye on your bags whilst you went snorkelling...although I'm sure you'd be safe enough leaving your stuff there..A very quiet beach compared to the hecticness of Manly.... Be aware of some glass on the beach though....

Its pretty but.... No swimming for 24 hours after rain, so says the sign! Pollution risk!
So that's a disappointment. Its a nice walk around here though and a cute beach.
the sweetest beach in the world. A little piece of sweetness on a beach - great snorkleing and such a pretty place - enjoy an afternoon at the beach in the real sence
Beautiful relaxing haven. Visit Manly, and make the walk to Shelly beach if you like quaint relaxing beachs and beautiful coastline.
Great Beach for families and alike. Great Beach and area for families and alike, feels more family orientated than for couples. Had a good time, been there 3 times now and would go back again.

great family place. The beach is accessed by a scenic walk from manly beach. Shelly is ideal for families as there is no surf so little ones and play in the shallows or older ones can snorkel. We take our six grandchildren here and relax knowing they are safe. There are several food out lets for either a snack or fancy lunch. There are some shaded areas for those extra hot days or for a picnic.If travelling by car there is a car park at the top. The views from Shelly are magnificent probably the best in Sydney. After 40 years of visits I never tire or fail to be impressed by this little slice of heaven.

The only west facing beach on the eastern coast of Australia. Shelly Beach is a beautiful protected beach, a short scenic walk along the coast from Manly Beach. Awesome snorkelling and diving and good for swimming - it's part of Cabbage Tree Bay, a protected marine reserve. Above Shelly Beach are some stunning viewpoints overlooking the coast and famous Bower Surfbreak - spectacular to watch on big swell.

safe swimming. a lovely walk along the Fairy Dell takes you to this quiet and less crowded beach. safe to leave your belongings on the beach pleasant families. very friendly people ready for a chat. well worth a visit
Gorgeous haven. A stunning sheltered beach that is well worth the short walk from Manly. There are a couple of bars at the beach plus plenty of space.
Lovely beach!. A must visit when in manly or Sydney! its a great ferry ride and worth going to visit! quieter and not as touristy as Bondi

Shelly is the secret beach of Manly. Take the walk on the south steyne to the best litle secret - Shelley beach. Kids can walk, easy and meandering. Snorkel, sun bake, look for crabs, jump off the rocks, scuba dive the reefs. Love it.

Absolutely beautiful and a hidden gem. most tourists don't know about shelly beach, but I'm sure we'll help with that. haha. When you do the little walk keep an eye out for the lizards all over the rocks on the right hand side, Don't touch them though, there's a hefty fine if you do. When you get to shelly beach there's a restaurant/toilets/change rooms and also a nice walk up to a scenic lookout. OH don't forget your snorkelling gear, swim about 100 metres out and you'll see some amazing fish.
For swimmers. Short (and lovely) walk from Manly, the only downside is rather gritty sand. It is sheltered from the surf so you can swim in calm seas without getting hit by boards!A little gem.

Great place for swimming, small children,beach parties or snorkeling or diving!. We love Shelly Beach. Its a great place for a beach party with friends and family and especially small children (no waves here).Local divers use this as their launching pad. Snorkelers and swimmers do the Manly to Shelly Beach swim.

A charming small beach and the walk there is lovely too. This small beach is nearly always sheltered from the wind and is safe for swimming (although not patrolled). It has some electric bbqs and a kiosk, toilets, fresh water and shade so on weekends with nice weather it is busy. Thewalk is worth it and very scenic (about 1km from the eastern end of manly beach). Keep an eye open for water dragons basking in the sun - they look great - but don't touch or feed them as they are protected.
nice beach. a nice little beach, but pretty crowded during the hot weather. the sand is shelly compared to the smoother sand at manly beach round the corner.

GREAT SNORKELLING!!. Such a beautiful spot during summer, especially mid week when it isn't too packed with people. I am a northern beaches local and can't get enough of snorkelling here, went last week and just so happened to spot a huge sea turtle on the sea bed, moments later it swam up to the top for a breath of fresh air... a truly magical moment to see! Definitely a must do if you're coming to Sydney in summer. I know there's a Mambo shop down there that hires paddle boards... they might hire snorkels too if you don't have your own. DON'T MISS IT!!!

Lovely local beach. Went across to Manly on the ferry and walked round to Shelly beach. Loved all the sea creature sculptures embedded in the rocks along the way. Small beach with BBQ facilities, toilets, cafe and upmarket restaurant. Beautiful place.

Great snorkeling. Smaller beach best visited on shoulder seasons but you can also snorkel from Manly beach and get out on rocky shoreline and explore. One small cafe and more expensive restaurant. Watch for giant lizards on the rock wall along the walk from Manly beach to Shelly Beach.

Quieter than Bondi. This was an unexpected treasure. Quiet, and calmer than Bondi that's for sure. A little hidden cove that is safe for kids and calm for paddle boarding. They have a very friendly little coffee shop with staff happy to pass on local information. There is a bike/walk path that takes you right around to Manly. We visited as part of a tour, but now I know it's there, I would definitely go back
Beautiful spot. Just a short walk from Manly, Shelly Beach is in a small inlet and is protected from the breaking waves, so very safe for small children, but just as nice for adults.

Favourite beach near Sydney. We visited a few of Sydney's northern beaches, but Shelly Beach was easily my favourite. The waters are protected by a small reef, and so much calmer than the waves at nearby Manly Beach. The beach itself lives up to its name (shell fragments rather than sand - not soft on the feet), but the main attraction was the easy snorkelling, with several colourful fish to be found just a few metres from the beach.

Great space for the family to enjoy the beach. If you want to enjoy a beach without the disturbance of heavy waves and surfers, Shelly Beach is for you. Just ensure that you take a picnic if you are enjoying the day with the family, you won't regret it
Save Our Dragons. The walk from Manly to Shelly was nice. Lots of little art pieces on the wall. The Sea Dragons were out and posing for pictures. The surf was moderate and fun to watch the surfers.

Great little beach. It's the unassuming, smaller sibling of Manly Beach for those who like calm water and the opportunity to just peacefully bob and float around with views of Manly beach and the coast all around. Manly and Bondi are great to look at--they are mighty beaches--but the waves are strong.
A little less hectic than the centre of Manly. Really nice beach with BBQ areas behind the sand; there's a few shops nearby selling food and drinks.One of the best spots in Sydney for snorkelling.

Perfect little cove. Manly itself is a really lovely place to visit and the Mexican is devine, but the little gem at the end tops the rest. Little touches like the public BBQ's and park benches set this off as a great day to enjoy the beech.

Small pebbley beach. A small beach just south of manly beach, you can walk to it in about 5 minutes. It attracts lots of families, as it appears protected from southerlies. The sand is coarse, with lots of rocks. The water is a bit murky close to the shore, but you can swim out 50 m and the water is much clearer. A great spot if you want a protected cove.
Busy but gentle warm waters. I love Shelly beach, it's a short walk from Manly Beach, but worth it for the gentle water and views. Gets quite packed in peak times!
Beautiful beach a short walk from Manly. This is a great beach, small, calm water so great for kids. A little walk so less busy than Manly. Great snorkelling with lots of fish to see.

Hidden Gem. What ever you do please do not get back on that ferry without checking out Shelley Beach!There is more to Manly than a few hundred metres around the Manly Jetty.Shelley Beach is a hidden Gem and features a lovely walk along the coast with clear seas and plenty of places to rest and dangle your feet in the water.Of course you can enjoy the water in may other ways too.See if you can spot the protected Lizards basking amongst the rocks.It is really only a short stroll to Shelleys Beach but it is a world away from the Manly that many tourists see.

A hidden treasure. As much as I love Manly, when you want to escape the crowds and day-trippers, Shelley Beach offers you peace and solitude with an easy swimming beach. An easy walk from Manly Beach if you are staying there.
