the little Beauty. relaxing at Shelly Beach is the most comfortable things you can do when you need a break during work. loving it!!!! one of the most beautiful places around Sydney
QUIET AND SIMPLY LOVELY.. Hidden gem - that locals know - but visitors should explore after the walk from Manly around the edge of the water.

Cozy beach. This small beach, its very nice to relax, with a few barbecue spots, you can spend a lovely afternoon with your friends. You get a really cool view from the beach,
And since you have to walk 10-15 mins, from manly beach and road, you get the feeling of being away from the city, in some kind of paradisiac beach.

A great beach at any time. Shelly Beach (the one near manly, not the one in Royal National Park) is an excellent spot for families with small children as it is safe and always protected from the weather. It is also a fantastic place for snorkelling as it is a marine sanctuary. It is also great at sunset because it looks more or less west.
Serene and beautiful. A hidden gem in Royal National Park. Good for swim/ snorkelling/ picnic. Usually not so many people and you also get good view to the city!
beautiful. our friends took us here, it is an amazing little paradise of a beach. unfortunately there was a sand storm at that time which spoiled out plans. But id like to go back someday.

Quaint lil beach. It's just few minutes from Manly beach. Looks like a small hidden gem. A bit cramped but worth it to stop and enjoy a coffee at before you proceed towards the nature walk from Shelly beach to Manly.

Lovely Walk - Manly Beach to Shelly Beach. On one fine sunny day, I took the ferry to Manly and decided to walk from one end of Manly Beach to the Shelly Beach side. Along the way I noted Marine Parade, the Cabbage Bay Aquatic Reserve and Shelly Beach. It was a lovely short walk (by my standards) and it was lovely just sitting on the beach park benches. The waters were simply clear and beautiful and perfect for swimming and snorkelling. I'd recommend Shelly to anyone who'd like a quiet place to swim in.
Romance at Manly. How romantic - to stroll to Shelly Beach and sit on the sand to watch the sun setting over beautiful Manly beach.

Short walk from Manly beach. Beautiful walk a long the coast with intermittent sculptures, passing a salt water swimming pool and a shop or two with trinkets in.
Beach was quieter than Manly and looked over the water towards it' smaller waves than the main beach and a few fishes to look at through your googles.
Public toilets, water station and a shop.

Secluded and worth the short walk from Manly. A trip to Manly is iconic - arriving a the old ferry terminal. There is short walk over to Manly beach - with the surf scene. However turn right and wander down the coast path and in about 10 minutes you reach Shelly Beach. This is a small secluded beach - often almost deserted.. and feels almost tropical. I have been a few times and every time have almost had the beach to myself. The bonus is a rather good restaurant - the Kiosk - on the beach. Certainly a place to go when in Manly. The walk over is very attractive past a natural open sea water pool and a very pleasant cafe where we stopped for a coffee. Come for a visit....
Best in the world. So clear, beautiful and exciting. This wonderful, family beach near North Head has grt locals (once was one!!), food, ambience and if you can spare the time the best waves

Lovely Place. Well, I guess I am prejudiced because Shelly Beach is where my future husband has asked for my hand in the marriage... It's very nice walk there from Manly Beach, I like the animals statues put into the rock edging the walk. Many birds to see, or crabs on the rocks, and there is a lovely restaurant(but rather pricy). Good beach to go snorkeling as well, there are some good spots.

Next to Manly a great little cove. Take a rest from the surfers and pop around to Shelly beach a quite cove overlooking Manly. With a nice bar and your own beach BBQ, it is a delight with safe surfer free swimming.
Wonderful place to sit and watch locals play. A pleasant stroll along the waterfront from Manly to Shelly Beach. Sadly there is not much shade available.
Beautiful. Hide away from manly beach, and is at the end of the manly walk.Its a very small beach where diving is practised. But the open bar looks amazing!

Diving +. We were visiting family in Sydney, and my husband decided we would have a scuba dive here. Was a very easy place to have a very pleasant, relaxing and easy, but not hugely exciting shore dive.It was a really nice place to sit between dives - two weddings on the beach while we were there - and be able to have a really nice lunch and coffee at the café after we dived. Advise anyone to arrive early however if they want a park. Also a nice protected safe beach for families. BBQ facilities, toilets, showers and water fountains. Café and Restaurant.

SLOW SERVICE FOR COUPON CUSTOMERS!. Great view and location, food good but we found the service to be excruciating slow! We dined using a Groupon coupon and diners who arrived after us were served first.

Beach hideaway. Once in Manly, wander over to Manly Beach, have some fun, but take some time to walk down to Shelly Beach along a walkway with interesting little sculptures embedded in the rock to be seen along the way. The snorkelling is pretty good too.

Tucked away treat. Shelley Beach is lovely, it's the perfect setting for a picnic. There is a sloping grassy area down to the sand, which has lots of shade. The beach itself is very sheltered and great for kids. The sandy area isn't huge, but that doesn't seem to matter. You might find yourself sharing the water with scuba divers, which is always interesting. The walk to the beach always has lots of people on it, but it is very pleasant nonetheless. I believe there are also barbecues for public use, although I haven't used them personally. There are also a couple of cafes where you can get anything from an ice cream to a full meal. Finally there are lots of scenic areas to explore behind the beach with fabulous views of the Pacific Ocean.

Great for a stroll and a calm swim. Always a favourite when visiting Manly for a quiet stroll and a swim in calm waters at the end of the walk. The restaurant along the way is expensive, however worth a drink looking at the beautiful water.Very relaxing

Lovely views of Manly Beach and town. Shelly beach is a peaceful cove with a rocky promontory at one end of the beach, lovely for a restful break from walking and sightseeing. The pleasant paved path along the rocks from the main beach at Manly is punctuated with unusual art works. There is a kiosk for snacks but it was closed when we were there. Glad we went as it's a lovely little unspoilt beach.

Shelly Sand. This little cove is right at the end of Marine Parade - or rather, at the start of it - that leads from Manly Beach round the headland to Shelly Beach. The sand is rather course, containing the crushed remains of millions of sea shells, so it's no good for building sand castles. However, for sitting relaxing, it's wonderful and it's also safe for the children to play. There are no facilities on the beach other than Le Kiosk, the fairly high priced restaurant at the back of Shelly Beach (reservations are advised, in my experience). It's definitely always on the list of priorities of things to do whilst staying in Sydney and no visit to Manly would be complete without a walk round to Shelly Beach.

More for the view. Shelly occupied a special position and remains quite calm, even on windy days. For that matter, it is the favorite of some locals. Be aware that the sand drop quickly so not the best choice with young children. That said, the coastal view from there is sublime.

Stroll from manly to Shelly Beach - fantastic!. The views on this gentle pathway from Manly to Shelly Beach are gorgeous! Several cafes along the way and toilets. Continue on past Shelly Beach, into the bush for spectacular views to the ocean.

A piece of paradise. If you visit Manly, a really nice walk to do is the walk from the South of Manly Beach to Shelley Beach. It's very popular with joggers, families, couples, tourists etc - and you get terrific views back to Manly. If there is no swell, then it is also a cool place to snorkel and if you are lucky you might see the protected big blue grouper fish. The beach has public barbecues, a grassy area and a kiosk. Very popular on the weekends, and always a good vibe. Once you've made it to Shelley Beach, make sure you walk up the hill and through the carpark to the track along the headland that has about 3 lookouts. When the surf is huge, this is a great place to watch really good surfers risk life and limb at the Bower, Winki-Pop and Deadmans.

Hidden Gem of a beach in Sydney. I visit Shelly regularly and I love it. Its a small beach and quite secluded which I prefer rather than a long touristy beach like Bondi. It is situated at Cabbage Tree bay marine reserve so there is great snorkeling...you can see Blue Gropers, Port Jackson sharks, Wobbegongs, Ray, Turtles (If you are lucky) and many many more. The only downside is that the car park is a bit of a nightmare to get to and not very large...but that is the same in all those Manly and surrounding areas.
Whales!. This is where we watched whales on an otherwise rather dull rainy day. Looks like it would be very nice on a summer day.
Harbour Cruise. What a wonder way to enjoy the Harbour.The best and cheapest way to enjoy the view of Sydney from the Water.
Manley's hidden treasures. Shelly Beach on the ocean side of Manley is a hidden treasure and worth the walk along the shore to visit the cafe or gift ware store.
great for scuba diving. it has a scuba place there, and its nice for a dive , there is some nice coral there and also of course fish

Lovely little beach. What a lovely little beach. It almost seemed private and off the beaten track. It's not too far from Manly Beach and easy to find. Very tranquil and lots of room to really enjoy it.

Sheelly Beach A Nice Place To Snorkel. A lovely five minute walk south along Manly Beach around the headland takes you to Shelly Beach which is sheltered from Southerly Winds and has calm waters. This is a marine park so there is plenty of fish to sea and even some Wobygong Sharks.

The best palce to swim and walk from Manly beach. Great view at the car park of the ocean and the rocks below. Great coffee shop and kiosk for casual or more formal dining . having a coffee after a swim still with the sand on the feet and enjoying the casual atmosphere of Sydney living. Great for families and building sand castles. I enjoyed snorkeling and viewing the big blue fish and the odd squid and other fish of varying kinds. Just to relax in the sun and watch the world go by is just magic .

An Aquarian. Shelly beach has now waves so its great for kids. But there are no lifeguards so be extra vigilant with young children. The snorkelling and diving is amazing - like being inside an aquarian. The facilities are good - free electric BBQ's, a really posh restaurant and a beach café with more reasonably priced food. The parking is expensive. Its okay to get the bus to Manly and then walk - but not a good option when you are loaded down with kids, beach gear and your food.

Well kept beach in Manly. Good spot, nice for swimming, snorkelling and diving, good walk to and from but you can drive there. the restaurant there is a bit fancy but otherwise it's an awesome spot for a bbq or day at the beach

Swim to Shelly Beach with the Bold and the Beautiful. A must do for anyone who likes swimming and likes beautiful beaches is the swim from Manly beach to Shelly beach. There is a group that leaves EVERYDAY from Manly at 7 am on the dot. There are fast and slow swimmers, young and old. Join in for the best way to see Manly and Shelly beach (and fish, turtles, octopus, rays and lots of other things). There is a fabulous core group who take photos, do a blog and post it to prolong the enjoyment. If you ask, they'll take your photo so get out there as soon as you can!

Sunset Beach. The only west facing beach on the eastern seaboard of Australia, Shelly is also a great beach for kids as the swimming is safe, gentle waves, and great snorkeling around the rocks. Some nice beach cafes too!
Great Beach.. Much better than Bond i and much more on offer Australia has some great beaches and this is one of them. Sit around and have a coffee and watch the passers by

Nice Family Beach. Shelly beach is a short walk from the Manly Beach and is a beautiful small family beach. Although it was a little crowded, the charm was not lost. A small walkway takes you up a hill that provides a beautiful panoramic view of Manly.

Chilled little beach with so much to do. Great place to enjoy the sand, have a BBQ, or relax in the calm waters. Because of the Bower head this beach has very small waves for being sea facing. Great place to bring a stand up paddleboard for learning and surfing on the bower. Bored with the beach? If so, there's hiking trails right behind the beach at North head that will take you to the cliff's overlooking the harbor entry.

Lovely little beach for kids.. Great walk around to this beach from Manly very popular walk. Super restaurant at the beachside 'The Kiosk', sit outside overlooking the beach while the kids play, or sit inside, great food, lovely waterview, watch the surfers & the scuber divers, or have a BBQ under the trees.
A little oasis. Shelly beach is a favourite of most locals. It is tucked away and even though it is only a few minutes walk from the bustling Manly, you could be at any quiet beach in Australia.

awesome beach & walk way. we grew up around this beach and recently went back with my kids to show them around and its just as i remember, well worth visiting and walking along the rock pools. a great way to spend an afternoon.

Favorite Dive Spot!. This is a great little gem of a beach. Parkland leads to the fine white sand of this protected bay. It faces West so it you can swim, snorkel and dive in almost all weather here. Great food nearby and beautiful clear waters. I dive here regularly both during the day and at night. The right side gets down to 10 or 12 metres and you can often see Woebegones and Port Jackson sharks there (totally harmless). There's always friendly Sydney Blue Groupers who want to play too. On the left side, the dive is shallower but has more diversity - giant cuttlefish, squid, and the occasional sea turtle or dusky whaler shark (again, harmless) join the regular crew. I've even seen stingrees, estuarine catfish and a motorcyle down there. For swimming and snorkelling this is a dream beach too not to mention paddleboards! Great place with great facilities.

A beautiful place to swim and snorkel in Sydney.. This is a beautiful little beach a short scenic 10 minute walk around from Manly. A great place for adults and children to swim, play and have a picnic. It is a marine reserve which is reasonably safe to swim, snorkel or scuba dive. There are a couple of cafes, shade trees, barbeques and limited car parking for a fee. You really need to get there early for a parking spot. I love to go snorkeling and swimming at this beach.

Best beach in Manly. I love this beach. The cafes are nice, the walk up to the ICMS college is great and even if you cross the beach and jut walk up the path, the views are spectacular. Perfect beach.

Pleasant Walk. A lovely gentle stroll that takes you from Manly Beach to Shelley Beach and back; you can even stop and have a coffee on the way. Really pleasant way to take a walk with the Pacific Ocean right at your feet.
Shelly Beach. Shelly Beach was beautiful. My daughter and I truly enjoyed every minute there. There was plenty do do and the weather was beautiful.

pleasant promenade. If I go to Manly I always walk around to Shelly Beach. It is particularly nice when the sun is shining and the sun is sparkling on the water. Interesting sculptures at various points along the way in addition to the ones created by nature.

Hidden Gem. What a lovely spot! Can't believe I have lived in NSW for over 50 years and never found Shelly Beach before. It is a lovely walk around there with great photo opportunities and a lovely café.
Great hidden beach. This beach is a shirt walk from Manly beach, abd us a secluded hideaway from the crowds. More or less Qest facing offers later sun in the afternoon.
Fantastic. Very Mediterranean, gentle swell, beautiful parkland setting. With Manly surf beach a kilometre's walk along the water. Then easy access to the ferry back to Circular Quay. Great day out.
Millions and billions of Shells. Pretty little beach covered with shells. A little rough on the feet coming out of the water but very pretty.
Paradise. What can I say.. It's a beautiful bit of paradise.. Can't wait to go back. Next time will hire bikes to see a lot more.

Ferry to Manly then a walk around the coast. This is a favourite walk of the north siders...the pathway from the main Manly ocean beach takes you around the bay. There is a nice little restaurant there where you can have an afternoon tea (or lunch). This is a very popular walk

Beautiful for snorkling. It's not like a reef or anything, but it's shallow, picturesque and truly relaxing. Lots of little kids around (possibly a bit clucky here) and only a short walk from Manly's main promenade.
Shelly Beach - a desirable location. I grew up here so I am biased. However the walk from Manly to Fairy Bower and Shelly Beach is wonderful. The water is clean and the beach is .. well... shelly.
Lovely Shelly Beach. In my opinion, one of the best place to relax in Manly. If you don't like waves, but like to swim it's perfect.
Great dive spot. This is a nice hidden beach and great diving and snorkeling if you straight out off the beach. One of my favourite places in Sydney

Manly to Shelly Beach. We were spending the afternoon on Manly and saw Shelly in the distance so we walked over. The walk was pleasant, but that's the only reason to do it. There's nothing special about being on Shelly Beach instead of Manly.
Lovely walk. Lovely beach walk with a few shops along the way. Beach clean and not overcrowded and there is a salt water swimming pool at the end of the beach which is free to use.

it has its name for a reason. This place is amazing ! Its good because its quiet and hardly any tourist that come and know about it. Good place to go when snorkling or to just go for a quiet swim without any of the big waves :-)

very unique sand. This place was my husband's favorite beach in Sydney. A short walk from Manly beach, this is a small beach with ground up shells as sand. It's beautiful but just a bit rough on the feet.

Manly Beach's smaller, quieter cousin. Just a short walk (enjoyable in itself along Cabbage Tree Bay Aquatic Reserve) from the south end of Manly Beach this is a sheltered cove with eateries, BBQs, water and toilets available. As other reviewers have commented, it is quieter than Manly and probably safer for young families. You should definitely include this in you visit to Manly. Le Kiosk was suggested to us for food and drink but we felt it was both pretentious and expensive so we passed on that one and returned to the greater choice offered in Manly, but if that's your type of thing then it is there and has a good reputation.
Very pretty beach. Very pretty beach at a secluded end of Manly. A restaurant and kiosk for lunch what more could you ask!
great family place. a beautiful safe beach for the entire family, plenty of eateries and lots of sport going on, good for snookering and diving.

Sunset Beach. Manly Beach is fantastic with waves and surfing action, whereas Shelly Beach is sheltered and calm, with excellent snorkelling to see exotic fishes. As one of few west facing beaches in Eastern Oz, you get a sunset too!

Lovely Beach.... Although you have a little way to walk to get to this beach. it is well worth it. Shelly Beach is gorgeous. Just a walk from Manly Beach where all the surfers are, this little beach is quieter and less surf. The water is really clear and clean.

Easy stroll, quite beach for the family... Walk south from the south end of the Manly Beach, through the pathway all the way to the Shelly Beach. It is a small beach, mostly used by the diving school and by the families. There is a kiosk that sells fish and chips and a French restaurant Le Kiosk. Both are great..

Pretty, sheltered beach. Our day trip to Manly Beach included a short walk south along the sea walk to this pretty little beach. Mid week was quiet and the little restaurant and beach stand were very nice. Not too cheapy or touristy looking. The cove is calm, beach is clean and the sand is coarser with the little shell pieces. They say the snorkelling is good here and we saw scuba divers going in. You might see water dragons as you walk the path. Lovely

amazing beach. I would strongly recommend doing the walk from manly proper to shelly beach. There are some off-the-wall sculptures on the way. The beach is protected with greenery everywhere. Great place for a swim (though not for body surfing). An easy walk.

North facing. One of the only north facing east coast Australian beaches. With a meandering walkway from Manly to Shelly Beach it has got to be one of Australia's most beautiful little beaches - in an art deco old fashioned sort of way. Only problem is it is very overcrowded on weekends.

A great beach for a swim. Shelly Beach is a small sandy beach about 1km from Manly Beach. Due to the aspect of the beach there are usually no waves here allowing for some great swimming. Often you will see swimmers swimming between Shelly Beach and Manly (Although it is often safe, make sure you are a competent swimmer in the ocean before trying this).The is a coffee shop/restaurent at Shelly Beach and another on the walk out.

Good snorkelling and diving. Shelly beach is really good for snorkelling. You can easily find rays, blue gropers and wobbegong sharks. The sharks tend to sleep under rocks in the daytime though so these are easier to see if you're scuba diving. The best places to go are on either side of the beach. The left side is my favourite where it is more rocky because there is more to see. The visibility tends to be quite good normally but I have been a couple of times when it's been choppy with a lot of sediment. There's a dive shop called divesydney (I think) which does scuba trips there at quite a good price, including night dives, which is really fun.

Great views. Shelly beach is a nice little beach tucked away in the southern corner of Manly. It has great views of Manly, the ocean, and many little coves and hikes line the area. I love traveling to Shelly beach!
Nice Beach. this is a nice little beach and relaxing little beach water so clean but so cold. Sydney has many beautiful beaches and this is one of them

Beautiful Views - Shelly Beach. Took a stroll over from our hotel and it was a very nice little beach. What i enjoyed most is the walk up the 'cliff' and the amazing views. It was a nice breezy day so we found it refreshing after the stroll.
A very pretty little place. It's nice to take a walk to Shelly Beach. People are often taught to dive in this location. It's a very nice walk from Manly, which is so busy. Quite a retreat.

Many and Shelly Beaches - a great combo. We took a Manly Fast Ferry from Sydney,(don't take the slow, multi-stop ferry) a totally enjoyable ride, and resulted in a wonderful day which included snorkeling at Shelly Beach (pronounced Shirley Beach) a great walk from Manly, enjoyable times at Shelly Beach, and eating a relaxing lunch in Manly. Shelly Beach is small and nothing spectacular but that is fine -- it is a quiet beach which is found at the end of a 10-15 minute totally enjoyable walk from Manly. Getting here is fairly simple -- get off of the ferry at Manly, ask for directions, walk about 2 long blocks to Manly beach passing many shops and restaurants along the way -- once at the beach boardwalk, turn right and take the walk until you bump into Shelly beach.Bring your own snorkeling gear -- we didn't find any outlets who sold or rented any. Or, forget the snorkeling and simply enjoy swimming and relaxing in this quiet spot. Bathroom - a decent bathroom is along the walk and not far from the beach.Dining - skip the restaurant at Shelly beach as it is a bit formal and stroll back to Manly and pick one of the many casual restaurants there.
Fun by the Seaside. Shelly beach is great. Snorkelling there was a blast. Having a hike then swimming in the water was the best thing. I will definitely return for another fun day by the seaside. :)

great diving. i love this spot for safe night diving to see the wonderful life that exsists at night a walk in dive from shore and lots dive shops offering dives there a must do ... day dives are good too but its the night life underwater that makes me come back here

delightfull small beach. Being the only sydney west facing ocean beach, Shelly is wonderfull on almost any day or wind condition. Unfortunately the crowds have found out about it too,so oon a windy day you may have to share with more than the usual crowd.Shelly is part of the cabbage Tree Marine Reserve which is an absolute wonderland of fish and sea creatures (some even insist Mermaids can be found here). You'll amost always find large groupers as this is a NO FISHING ZONE. fantastic for snorkelling. in the calmer waters and around the point.With the Bower surf break out on the point and the calm water of the bay , stand up paddle boarding has really taken off as anyone from beginner to experienced can try SUP here and have a fantastic time. There are also free BBQ, but get there early to use them as the backpacker fraternity and overseas students have also found the 'free' in them and hog them all day and evening.There is an upmarket restaurant call the La Kiosk and a food takeway on the beach with the snorkel and SUP hire just 100 meters away on the ocen walkway towards Manly

Beautiful!. I loved shelly beach's cool, clear and calm water. No waves, so it's perfect for just relaxing and a few people had kayaks and stand up paddle boards a bit further out. The water is clear blue and its beautiful. Best day we had in Sydney!

A little disappointing. Definitely do the walk from Manley to Shelley beach as its lovely. However food options when you get there are poor and there is no shade from the sun on the beach so be prepared.
A favorite!. Great snorkelling around the area. Well worth a visit. No need for fins - the water is calm, the distance isn't far, and it's fairly shallow.

A very quiet part of Sydney's Manly Beach shoreline. A safe, small beach area, by the walkway, and frequented by learner scuba divers. Relatively coarse sand, but extra good and safe for the littlies, with good walks up the hill towards some of the North Head Ferry wharf.

Cute little beach with lots of activities. I stopped here with friends mid-week during the day. There were people snorkeling, scuba diving, swimming, surfing and even school groups coming to practice board rescue.

perfect walk. its a great walk from manlyand a nice swimming outlet where there is no surfif you dont like waves muchperfect snorkling areabyo own drinks and food the cafe there is overpriced and not very good, but does cover most things if you need, staff at the cafe normally bite your head off and grumpy

great beach. a bit of a walk from manly ferry, but totally worth it!!!! Stop and swim in a rock pool between manly & shelly beach. Set back so not as strong of currents- great for kids to get in the water.
Beautiful. A lovely walk from Manly to a beautiful little cove with safe swimming. Cares and restaurants available en route but a bit pricey!

One of the best city beaches I've seen in the world. Very safe for kids, nice restaurant, small cafe for icecream, lovely walk from Manly, accessible with kids/strollers/disabled, still scenic and relatively quiet/undeveloped considering it's location. A world class city beach.

WOW! Why don't more people know about this? Get your snorkel. If you're interested in avoiding massive crowds and seeing lots of fish while snorkeling, this is the place to be!! A 20 min walk south of Manly Beach, this place was relatively open on a weekend. Manly was crazy during the same period. Went snorkeling and literally 2 meters from the edge of the water were tons of fish. I don't know anything about fish, but there were striped fish, a school of probably 3-500 small silver ones, parrot fish, and a huge blue fish about 2 feet long. I did not go more than 50 meters from shore. Great for families and people who don't want to swim far from shore.
Beautiful. Great beach in Manly, clean, full of amenities, great surf and near nature reserve. Much better than most beaches in SE Asia.

Sand between your toes. Tucked away at the end of the more popular Manly Beach is a delightful sheltered, sandy (well shelly, gritty) beach free from the waves that comes ashore on Manly itself and therefore free of surfers. It can therefore be used more when the waves are dumping onthe main beach. Being a kind of eddy, backwater it does attract floating creatures and jellyfish can be a problem. The snad being coarse doesn't make that good a sand castle but for the kids it is a gentle sloping entry to the water.Walking from Manly itself is just a mere 15 minutes and there is plenty to see and do with cafes should you so wish.

nice little beach. this beach is great for a swim, it's fairly pretected so the waves don't get too big. threr are plenty of rock pools to look in, BUT be warned there are some BLUE RINGED OCTOPUS in the area so look but don't touch

Waves, sea life and coffee!. This is the perfect family beach - walk from Manly, past fairy bower (look for sea glass at low tide). Put the mask and fins on to check out the groper and cottlefish families. Coffee and ice cream at the kiosk.

Pretty cove.. This is a very pretty little beach at the end of the seaside walkway from Manly Beach. It is in a natural cove tucked into the surrounding wooded hills. It was calm when we were there and there were many paddle boarders and swimmers. There is also a grassed picnic area above the beach with built in BBQ's. From here there is a path and steps that lead up over the hill where you have a wonderful view out to sea and then further around of Manly Beach.On the main beach are a couple of restaurants, one very informal and the other an attractive fine dining establishment. There are also change rooms and bathroom facilities on the beach. Definitely recommend a visit here if you are going to Manly and would like a seaside walk ending up at this beach.

Lovely little beach tucked away from everything. There is a small road going from Manly to Shelly Beach. No cars are allowed so you can either walk (very nice) or take a bicycle. I really enjoyed this place as it has something magic. It's pretty small and this gives this place a special touch of exclusivity.
great walk. Great walk from Manly to Shelly beach, passing the swimming pool and the sea. Lovely safe beach for children

little and beautiful. it's attached to Manly beach pretty much, if you are looking for more intimacy then it is best to walk to shelly beach from Manly. Unlike manly beach this has no surfers, it has a park and bbq so you cab bring your own food.

Shelly Beach. A beautiful little beach
After a very short walk from Manly Beach around the head land you find this delightful little beach

Good beach and snorkeling in Sydney. Nice small beach next to Manly. It has its own parking (~40 cars and ~8$/hr) but seems that many locals park along the road.My main interest was the Marine reserve which is between that beach and Manly : Cabbage Tree which is a good snorkeling in Sydney I think : Wobbegong, Blue groupers, Dusky Sharks (did not get the chance to see any)It is definitely not a surfing beach as it is well protected by a reef and is not facing the open ocean.

Your own private heaven. Shelley Beach is a nice 5 minute stroll from the Manly Ferries, and gives viewers a nice escape from the hustle and bustle of the Manly tourist strip (the set of shops from Manly Ferry leading up to Manly beach).Shelley Beach is a little corner beach which has nice rocks where people can swim off and go snorkelling. The water is crystal clear, and quite often on summer days one can notice small fish swimming at the bottom of the ocean.Definitely a relaxing and pleasurable experience swimming at Shelley Beach. Highly recommended!
idyllic seaside beach in cove without surf. a tranquil spot on the with a great seaside walkway around the foreshore from Manly surf life saving club. Very safe swimming. Kiosk restaurant excellent.
Ideal for kids. We took my baby grandson here and he loved it, it's small and private and ideal for young children, the beach is gorgeous and it has a cafe there so you can get something to eat.

Lovely small beach. Small fairly private beach that is well protected from winds that is used mostly by locals, divers and snorkellers. Very nice walk from Manly Beach along the waterfront but also accessible by road.

Excellent walk around to Shelly Beach. It's a lovely walk around the coastal footpath from Manly Beach, and accessible with a pram, wheelchair, or pushbike. There is a lovely beach and grassed BBQ area, with barbeques provided. There are a few cafes, a gift shop, and a restaurant along the coastal path around to Shelly Beach.
Beautiful Beach. Pristine beach, calm sea, nice location, lovely walk to get there - sand a little bit shingley!!Nice cafes nearby.

Sensational Beach. The beach, cafes, and the rockpool on the walk around are awesome....
One of the Jewels in the crown for Manly!
families and picnickers. Small beach with good restaurant cafe and family atmosphere. Lots of people enjoying the space. Access to good walk

Excellent snorkeling and beach spot. Thoroughly enjoyed snorkeling with clear water. Large variety of fishes and a few sting rays.
The beach is very good and if you have it you can actually swim across to Manly beach.
Great for a quick dip. Great for snorkeling and when the main beach is closed due to rough weather. Paddleboard hire is available nearby for those who are so inclined. Take your sun shade!
A little magical cove. Take the Manly beach walk and end up at Shelly Beach. It is magic and there is some excellent dining places on the way. Great place for a swim or a surf depending on the swell.

a beautiful spot. I love it here, it is absolutely beautiful! the beach is pretty and protected from rough waves. Get there early on a weekend, as it gets crowded and there is limited parking - which is metered, so be sure to pay.
OR its a short walk from Manly.
Also, the walk around the headland is really pretty too.

Recommended by Manly Visitor Center...and I Agree. Shelly Beach is a protected cove 15 minute walk south of Manly Beach. Perfect for relaxed swim. Gentle waves. Pics Uploaded.Water may also be slightly warmer too.Public change and indoor shower area without charge. No lockers for valuables.Took ferry from Circular Quay Terminal to Manly Wharf. Then walked down Corso Street, and turned right at beach. Total time from ferry to Shelly Beach is about 15-20 minute walk.Sign says water may be unsafe/contaminated after a rain...what's that all about??

So close to metroplois and a million miles away. If you are coming from the city then you must catch the Ferry, a short walk through the Corso till you get to Manly beach then turn right and walk another 15 minutes till you find the most delightful little alcove, of sand, blue water and palm trees, nestled behind the headland. Somewhat protected, its not at all like a city beach. Bring your snorkel and be surprised at the sealife that lives abundantly in these waters, and take a deep breath of beautiful coastal air, coffee shops and Le Kiosk may also tempt you, go on, its gorgeous.

Shelly beach. I love Shelly Beach and I go there all the time, no matter what time of year it is. It is a great beach for swimming as it has a newly renovated surf club and life guards on patrol. It is also a dog friendly beach, making it a great place to take your furry friend out to socialise and have a run.

Cute, protected diving beach. At the quieter end of manly this safe protected bay is perfect for divers, plenty of them about, and catching sight of some beautiful fish. Popular wedding spot, can get very busy in summer or on any warm day.
Relax. Relax, swim, walk and take in the sites and the sun. Scuba dive . Eat and enjoy the view and walk back to the Manly Ferry to go back to town.
great beach. short walk from manly to shelly and some breath taking views along the way. beautiful beach with some unique little shops along the way
Nice walk from Manly. Easy flat walk from Manly, beautiful on a sunny day with the sun glistening on the water, check out the divers in the bay and have a coffee at the end of it.
Hidden treasure. Away from the hussle and bussle of Manly. Great for families. Great walks up to the headland. The walk from Manly is right along the shore line. Spectacular.

Great diving. A great little diving spot if you pick the tides right, but the parking isn't the best for beach access. If you aren't a diver, try swimming or walking from Manly beach around to Shelly Beach and back. The restaurant is pretty decent there as well.

Great sheltered beach. Shelley Beach is a small beach but it's relatively sheltered from the winds. It was quite a windy day when we went there but at Shelly it was quiet and warm.
There's a nice walk you can do up into the forest where you can look out over the ocean. We spotted some whales off the coast there.

A little hidden treasure.. Walk around from Manly to Shelly Beach. We did so and saw a swimmer doing it the hard way, divers near the rocks and lots of bird life. The little bay is popular with families.

Very pretty. This is a really pretty little beach and it takes you away from the crowds on Manly Beach. The views from the car park are spectacular and the houses grand. There is either a Kiosk or restaurant where you can enjoy a relaxed and scenic lunch.

Worth a visit beautiful beach. A short walk from Manly this is a gorgeous beach and there are amazing Water Dragons (protected big lizards) on the footpath for all to see . We stayed for the afternoon on the beach but wish we had longer. The weather wasn’t great whilst we were in Sydney but we got a lovely suntan whilst we were at this beach as the weather seemed to be better by the cost.

Great. After you have cruised over to Manly on the wonderful ferry, take a walk to Shelly Beach. It is a beautiful little bay at the northern end of Manly Beach. There is a nice little cafe and a great restaurant and it is well worth a visit
Seclusion in the city!. This beach is gorgeous! Much smaller than the nearby beaches, this beach was fun to get to and lovely to swim at. If you want fewer crowds, this is a good place to visit.
Great little beach. This has a great view of Bondi beach but this beach has shallow water, great for familes. A bit of a walk but it is great once you get there.
Great Walks. The only thing that didn't work out for us was the weather. It's a very pretty place and intersting walks.
An old favorite. One of my favorite beaches in Sydney. Lovely oasis hideaway with superb restaurants. Bring some cash, and make the trip!

Paradise ! Must see. Shelly beach is a gem you can have the most amasing scuba dives, snorkelling and senic walks up to north head. Or you can just sun bath on the beach and enjoy the public bbq's that are free to use. Its only a ten minnute walk from manly and not hard to find just head south and you are their!

It's one of the "Shire's" best-kept secrets. There may be more than one "Shelly Beach", but "my" Shelly Beach is in Cronulla, reached by car or rail, and offering BBQ facilities, kiddies' playground, food outlets nearby, a rock pool, and changing rooms for men and women.

A hidden gem. Manly Beach's better looking little brother. While the tourists pile down the Corso and dive straight onto Manly's tree-lined beach, the locals avoid the crowds by strolling 15 minutes the other way to the lovely Shelly Beach. Has a great coffee-hut -and is the starting point for the Manly heads walk (beware the spiders).

Clear water. Beautiful clear, clean surf and sand. The walk along the scenic footpath is magnificent. We caught the Manly ferry and then walked to Shelley beach. The sun was shining and the sand was a lovely white soft sand, even if you don't go in for a swim, the walk along the beach is just the tonic to pick up ones spirits.

quiet, nice place to picnic. Grills provided, nice walking trail to the right and left, close to the water dragons that sun them selves near the rocks, crystal clear water with good diving/snorkeling.
Pretty little beach. One of my favourite little beach. it does get crowded but it is so pretty around there it kind of is worth it.

Enjoy the tranquility. Get up early in the morning - walk along the foreshore - devoid of people. Enjoy the golden sand, the gentle rising sun and thee soft roar of the surf on the beach. People will come - to pray, to meditate, to exercise, to surf, to set up for coffee and food, to watch over swimmers, to enjoy the day.So be early.

Lovely Beach, lovely walk. It's is a really lovely little beach to visit the next time you go to Manly. Take the walk round to Shelley and then reward yourself with an ice-cream or a coffee and enjoy the place for a while. Friends of ours married on the beach there a number of years ago which was our first intro to the place, and, since then, I or we wander there when visiting. Family friendly, but nice for couple too. It's close to the rat race of tourist Manly, but feels a hundred miles away.
Shelly Beach. Beautiful small beach a nice walk from Manly beach to Shelly beach and a couple of nice restaurants there to have lunch which we did on a beautiful warm day.

magical spot. I attended a wedding here years ago and thought it absolutely enchanting. We revisited this year, walking along the boardwalk from Manly Beach and stopping to swim in the rockpool at Fairy Bower on our return walk. Magical!

Pretty little beach. As you walk from Manly this is a secluded little beach. Really lovely and very safe for families. There is a restaurant there too although can be a bit hit and miss. Take a picnic and enjoy this sheltered little spot.
Great beach. Tucked away a short 5-10min walk form busy Manly beach, this is a great beach for a group of friends to have a get-together and chill for a few hours.
Beautiful. Great beach away from Manly, more local and one of the best restaurants on the Northern Beaches just sitting alongside it!

Lunch with a view. Shelly beach is a lovely little beach round from Manly. We went to Manly for the day and walked around here for our lunch stopping at Le Kiosk. Le Kiosk is a fantastic 'takeaway' where we had calamari and chips sitting out in the sunshine at the tables enjoying the most fantastic of views. Just lovely - oh and I forgot to mention it was made more special being on my honeymoon with my wife.

An isolated paradise. This is like an off-shoot of Manly - if you want peace and solitude , this is it.Hard to find if you don't know but also an enjoyable walk from the Manly crowds.Others have questioned the cafes that sit by it but one of my favourite pastimes over the years has been a daay at Shelly Beach starting with breakfast at the cafe on the sidewalk - a wonderful way to enjoy a summer's day in Sydney.

A gem.... That pretty little beach around the corner from Manly....A tiny spot of paradise. Crowded in summer, but a great spot for a beach picnic if you can snag a possie under the fig trees.Have lunch at le Kiosk, then sit out for the rest of the afternoon, drink cocktails and watch the sun set.....paradise....

Gumbell. A flat walk from Bondi Beach along a seaside path enlivened with small sculptures in the rocks leads you to a small quiet beach, seldom crowded, with scuba divers to watch and an excellent restaurant

Faces west so wonderfully warm afternoons a delight.. From Manly Surfe Lifesaving Club at the eastern end of the beach, take a leisurely 20 minute stroll, stopping at a tea house half way, to "Shelley." A fine restaurant here and also a cafe. Kids big and small can play safely on the sand and paddle the foreshores for hours. Not nearly as busy as the famous Manly yet hidden minutes away.
Quiet scenic little beach.. Quiet scenic little beach, short walk from Manly. Lovely views, superb in the evening as the sun is going down. Wonderful.
Picturesque.. Close to the ocean and travelling from beach to beach, this walk is delightful. It is popular and fortunately has a cafes at either end and the restaurant at Shelly Beach is great.

Crystal water and protected little cove. I like the little beaches that are away from the main attraction. There's a nice cafe/bistro next to the beach, and because it's not a sandy beach the water isn't murky. But it isn't as nice to sit on if you don't have a beach towel so make sure you bring one!!

Beautiful little beach. A must visit when in Manly - worth the beautiful walk from Manly along the sea-side to Shelly Beach. Toilets, cafe and a restaurant are there if you feel hungry. Crystal clear, fresh water protected in a little inlet - surrounded by rocks - love this place!

A magical place. Put it tihs wa, 2 sets of friends have got engaged here. A lovely peaceful spot, with a great coastal walk to get to it. Great for swimming, snorkelling, lazing on the beach, watching the whales and/or surfersfrom the headland. Magical. Tip: there are bbqs and a cafe and a restaurant here so make a day of it.

A pearl in the shell. Shelly beach is our favorite as a family beach. Small, protected from waves and with some nice cafees and restaurants in the surrounding. And just a 10 minute walk from the busy Many Beach if you want to expand your views.

shame really. Beautiful place, great to stop off for a drink and perhaps something to eatSadly of the two eating places, one serves the worlds worst coffee and is poorly run and the other seems to turn everybody away unless they've booked and then the whole place sits empty with never a soul in its magnificent restaurant!In 10 years Ive only ever seen two tables occupied. Shame really, could be fantastic

One of Sydney's most picturesque walks. Every traveller to Sydney should take the Ferry ride to Manly to experience the essence of beachside living at its best. The walks along the ocean and Harbour beachfronts from Manly Cove To Fairlight and then from beach to the north and then to Shelley beach are some of the Worlds most picturesque sights. The stunning still waters of Shelley beach and the spectacular coastal views from its Headland, Fairy Bower have to be seen to be believed. There are abundant cafes along the shores and keep an eye out for Dolphins, Whales and Surfers enjoying the Ocean.
Diamond in Manly. Beautiful beach in Manly. Calm and the water is calm, no need for lifeguards and easy to swim in. Rare in Sydney
hidden. Nice get away and isolated from Manly. Glad we came here because the sun was off and on as we saw it passing Manly and heading towards us.
A perfect start at 6am. Water perfect temperature for swimming, less crowds plus reef sharks(harmless) and dolphins to be seen

Shelly Beach. Relaxing walk from Manly. Excellent views along the harbour. Many scuba diving enthusiasts use the beach as a base for scuba diving. Cliff top at one end of the beach provides a great view of the Pacific Ocean.

Great for little children to swim. This was a beach we used a lot when the kids were little as there are very little waves. It is also a great place for a picnic as there are BBQ's and a grassed area. We often enjoy a coffee or icecream at the cafe here after walking from Manly. The children still like to explore the beach rocks and the bush area along side. You will often see divers and people snorkelling here.
Nice little beach. Great place to have a swim or picnic. The waves are about the size I like - nearly flat

A lovely short walk from Manly Beach. If visiting Manly Beach, this short coastal walk to Shelly Beach is well worth doing. Lovely scenery and art work to view on route. Shelly Beach looks lovely, but swimming is not advisable after heavy rain.
Pleasant little beach - perfect for the young family with still waters, excellent snorkelling and a nearby cafe.. Really recommend the snorkelling and the swim across to Manly Beach
Great spot. Even though there were lots of people it was great to visit. Beach was clean, water was lovely. Great atmosphere.

Gorgeous and a bit more secluded. Although this beach is in the middle of Sydney its a bit more removed from the busier Manly Beach which it is adjacent to. Great cafe/restaurant. To get there walk catch a ferry to Manly, walk along the Corso then tun right at the Beach and head to the only Sydney North facing beach at the end of the path.
Stunning Ocean side of Manly. Take the Beautiful Manly Ferry return walk to Shelly Beach and LOVE it!
When the wind blows from the South/South East... head to Shelly Beach. Beautiful, protected, perfect for swimming or snorkeling. take your picnic basket or visit the cafes nearby.

Best Beach Pictures!. We stumbled upon Shelly Beach by accident. We used the Manly Ferry to go see Manly Beach, then walked along the Manly Scenic Walkway. Along the way, there are pretty neat sculptures to enjoy, built right into the rocks, and at the end was Shelly Beach. Walk a couple 100 feet further and beyond Shelly Beach, there is a path up along the cliffs. There are lots of beautiful birds and great views.  We didn't go swimming, as it was May and pretty chilly with spotty rain showers, but check out my pictures and you'll see why we thought it was worth going.
Good Day out. All Sydney beaches have their own specialness, the sheltered cove and clear water are all a bonus here - grab some fish and chips and relax for the afternoon you can't go wrong.

Charming, sheltered little cove, just a few minutes from Manly. The walkway from Manly beach leads to Shelly, passing tiny marine sculptures set into the walkway walls. Everyone loves it, and with good reason. Kids frolic in the shallows, divers trudge across the sand and sink into the deeper waters to explore, swimmers of all ages take advantage of the serene waters, away from the surf.On land, there's a variety of eateries offering take-away, casual and up-market dining for breakfast, brunch, lunch & dinner. An interesting corner shop opposite my favourite cafe, The Bower, stocks the bounty of the owners' travels.Those wanting a longer walk, can take the path through the carpark and explore the Manly Scenic Walk.This is a part of the world I know well as a local & never loses the "Wow" for me.

a small but icredible beach. shelly beach is near Manly, you can reach it walking for a while through an awsome path. You can do snorkel, diving, surf. I have seen several times some weddings organised in the beach... So now maybe you are agree it's a wonderful place.

Go east!. This could be the furthest east you ever go in your life! (Ironically, it's also famous for being the only west-facing beach on the east coast of Australia.) About twenty minutes' easy walk from Manly Beach and well worth it. Another beautiful beach, leading to the fabulous coastal walk.
West facing beach on the East Coast. Don't expect surf, but if you like a sheltered beach with views back over the city of Sydney, within easy walk from Manly, then Shelly ?Beach is not to be missed.

Charmingest Little Beach In Sydney. While technically an ocean beach, Shelly beach curls around and faces "the wrong way" i.e. not out to sea, so it is very flat, calm and sheltered. The stroll around from manly (a kilometre or so?) is lovely, and it's got a lovely grassy area for picnics/hanging out, and a lovely restaurant if you want to be a bit less casual.
Very pretty beach. Would be lovely for a wedding.. It is very pretty with a lovely restaurant on the beach. Would be a lovely place for a family picnic and a bar-b-que.
lovely ... ..little cove close to manly beach good for swimming in calm waters as there´s virtually no waves. The walk there is also v nice & a great spot to enjoy the sunset.
A CHANGE FROM MANLY. A little sun trap about a 10 min.walk round the headland from MANLY main beach,nice swimming and refreshments are easy to reach straight off beach,well worth a visit
Beautiful walk. It is a great walk from Manly to Shelly. Especially on a sunny day in autumn or winter with only a few people around.
cute beach. very small cute beach, nice for watching the surfers ride the waves
Great place to go if Manly is too busy. Nice little beach, great for snorkeling, nearly a cove, has some rocks you can lay on to get away from crowds, nice walk to get here from manly

Wonderful beach!. We used to visit Shelly Beach as kids, and I loved in particular the whitewashed rock pool on the way. Made sure I took my grandchildren there on a recent trip. Oh to have the money to buy in the area!
Nice beach for families. This small beach is nice and has fewer hazards. Don't miss the cliff trail toward the back of the beach area. That is the true hidden gem!

Shelly Beach picnic. Shelley beach is a very protected beach, so no matter what the conditions at South Steyne, North Steyne or Queenscliff (Manly Beach) you will find safe swimming at Shelley. The walk around to it is beautiful and there is a variety of marine life around the rocks, so take your snorkelling gear. A picnic on the sand makes a great outing as Shelley beach is a sun trap.
great snorkling. great snorkling and loverly day at a great beachdo the walk to Mnaly as well

Shelly Beach Walk. A delightful clifftop walk around the headland of Shelly Beach. Look up and you'll see dozens of large spiders on webs just above head height. Trees, colourful rocks, golden sand and, of course, Manly Surf Beach in the background.
nice walk. We walked up here from Manyly Beach. Shelly Beach was secluded, and quite busy, even at 5pm.
take your snorkle. The water was calm even when manly beach was closed due to waves. Be sure to take your snorkle. Watch for water dragons on your walk there.
nice and calm. we had a great day at that beach. we strongly recommend going on that beach since there are not big waves and is small and cute.

Wonderful Spot. Shelley Beach is such a lovely place to have a picnic at in the park or a meal at the restuarant. Only a short walk from Manly along the walkway and you move from the suft beach to a sheltered cove.
beautiful secluded cove. A healthy promenade walk away from hustle of Manly - best mid-week to avoid crowds - ideal for a picnic lunch

Shelly Beach. A lovely secluded spot a short walk away from Manly Terminal. beautiful beach and a lovely scenic coastal walk awaits those who wish to go that little bit further. Refreshments are available with plenty of seating scattered around for those weary legs. would definitely suggest a visit.
a tucked away gem. It's worth the walk from Manly to Shelly beach. Enjoy the great views while you walk along the coastline. Stop for brunch or lunch at the Bower Restaurant
Love Shelly beach. A great thing to do when you're in Sydney is get the Ferry across to Many and then walk all the way around to Shelly Beach. It's gorgeous!

Lovely sheltered little cove. Shelley Beach is a very pretty sheltered beach around the bay from the main Manley beach. It is a well sign posted very easy level 20 mins walk from the main beach and is very popular with families and snorklers. The water is calm here and shallow for a fair way so ideal for small children, there is a BBQ area, toilets and a car park at the back. There is a stylish restaurant and also very pleasant licensed cafe which is a great place to sit by the beach and have a glass of wine and a light lunch.

Snorkelling in Sydney. I went to Shelly Beach with my husband and parents specifically for snorkelling, as it had been mentioned as pretty well the only worthwhile place to snorkel anywhere in Sydney.We went on a very beautiful sunny day on the Easter weekend, which in itself provided some additional hassles that I can only presume (or hope) were exaggerated due to our timing.We could not find parking anywhere nearby and ended up having to pay $60 for parking at a parking station on Manly Corso. Thankfully, the walk from there to Shelly Beach is quite pleasant.The beach area itself is really lovely with both sand and grass to utilise, as well as plenty of shade thanks to al the trees. We also had fun spotting several water dragons on our way. The snorkelling area is quite sheltered and fairly safe water (essential as not all of our party are strong swimmers). The visibility was not great on the day we went, but we still managed to see some schooling fish and a couple of large groupers, though very little else. All in all it was a very pleasant and enjoyable day, though the snorkelling itself is far from spectacular - though this is to be expected when you snorkel outside of tropical waters.
Hidden Cove. Loved the fresh water pool on this walk. Very relaxed and alive
Underwhelmed. Inexperienced staff let the atmosphere down. Food OK
Lovely spot. Sheltered beach, calm clear water and grassy area behind beach
Climb on the nearby rocks. Beautiful! It was a perfect day for climbing on the rocks and watching the surfers.

A big letdown- this is NOT a good snorkeling spot!. After hearing about Shelly Beach being the best snorkeling spot in Sydney my boyfriend and I decided to check it out. We were hugely disappointing. The beach was tiny, overcrowded and an actual snorkeling experience was a joke! There was nothing underwater. I would not recommend this as a tourist attraction.
Magical walk. Take a walk to this lovely calm beach and take in the places and faces enroute. It is a lovely part of the world.

Well worth the walk. Wonderful stroll along the ocean to a safe, small beach. Ideal for intimate beach weddings and children to swim. The cafe is expensive, however the food is good and a drink outside facing the ocean is a must.
Secluded beach near Manly. Lovely for children as their are no waves, trees for shade, lots of sand for kids to play.

No swimming after rough weather. The beach that is 10 minutes walk from the Manly village and is a pleasant place to visit. People go there to have BBQ´s and sit with their dogs, relax in the sun or sit under the trees. It is a good all rounder type of beach that isn´t too crowded.On the way to the beach there are nice little shops and you also get to see surfers brave the waves. The only thing you have to observe is that the water isn´t safe to swim in after a storm. Sewage that is piped offshore gets wasked back onto the beaches so be careful on those days.

Wedding Place. We got married on Shelly Beach,in Cronulla, it was just beautiful. Highly recommend taking the train out to it. IF your getting married Coral Kortlepel marriage celebrant,http://www.getmarried.com.au/contactinfo.htm as she was truly helpful for every aspect.
safe swimming. Worth the ferry trip from Circular Quay to walk to this delightful beach for a safe, surf-free swim and then return via the cliff walks with glorious bird life.

Cute and Secluded. I love Shelly Beach. It is great for sunbathing because it is blocked within a Quay from wind. You can hike, bike, walk, sunbath, eat, drink and have a spectacular day at Shelly Beach. Access it via Manly Beach. When facing Manly Beach walk right and continue to Shelly Beach.
Paradise!. The 15-minute walk to Shelly Beach is a must when you visit Manly. A great place to dive, relax and admire the beaitiful scenery.

Lovely walk with great photo opps. Enjoyable walk with beach views, interesting rock formations, surf views and better than the norm gift shops and kiosks. Liked the Peter animal sculptures along walk too.

Such a cute little beach!. In a almost private alcove. Plenty of little beach front restaurants. Tons of shells to collect so I suggest bringing a pair of flip flops. Worth the walk from the Manly wharfs. Very intimate feeling
Only west facing beach on eastern seaboard.. Calm beach, no nets, great facilities and lovely first thing
Le kiosk. Good food great view try the squid infused angel hair pasta

A Sydney MUST SEE!. The most gorgeous sheltered beach, albeit very popular. Bring your mask and snorkel and have a paddle. The Kiosk restaurant on the beach is lovely too. Just beware - parking is expensive and difficult to find. It is much easier to stroll around from Manly and enjoy the little knick-knack store half way along the path.

Great for snorkelling, avoid the weekends and you will have the beach to yourself.. This is a 20 minute casual stroll from Manly on a cement path following the coast. Great sea pool and swimming from the rocks along the path. There are great snorkelling/scuba opportunities here. Water is very clear and it is a delight to swim here. The sand is coarse but very clean, there are showers and toilets and one expensive restaurant and a very good value for money cafe adjacent to each other. Try the tuna salad toasted panini.... delicious!. There is a pleasant woodland walk with lovely views adjacent to the car park and for the more adventurous, there is the Sydney Head walk. We did part of it and the views are lovely.

a calm small beach in picturesque setting. This family beach is an easy walk around from Manly beach and perfect for those who want to swim but avoid the big waves. There is a treed area providing shade for picnics and it is also well serviced with 2 restaurants/kiosk. It is at the end of the scenic walk way
Family friendly. Close to Manly quite spot for picnic and family friendly safe swimming in the harbour.

Small and secluded. This beach is about a 10 minute walk from Manly Beach. It is much smaller and quieter than Manly. The beach is made up of shells...hence the name. Bring your snorkel gear!! It appeared to be a much safer beach since there appeared to be quite the riptide at Manly.
Good swim area. Pretty especially for families and safe clean beach
Not so Shelly. So tranquil, so pleasant, so relatively quiet. Wonderful for swimming and snorkelling. Just another Sydney paradise

Calm and refreshing. A lovely spot isolated from the main beach at Manly. The waves are gentle, the water clear. Lovely for a relaxing paddle in the ocean. Then it's a short walk to Manly to have lunch, a coffee or a gelato.

Fabulous walking path from Manly. Lovely walk around the rock area to Shelly Beach. I had my wedding reception at LeKiosk in 1976 and the restaurant is still open under the same name. Really enjoyed reading all the dedications on the park benches which have been placed along the footpath from loving relatives/friends. Make sure you go up on the headland to see the views all the way along the north coast and out to sea.
sheltered snorkelling in sydney. good for snorkelling away from the crowds at Manly beach. nice calm waters.
Natural, unchanged since Captain Cook dropped anchor. Bit of a walk from Manly but worth it. Unspoilt and lots of marine life in the water, take your snorkel and goggles.
Worth the walk. Walk from Manly to Shelly Beach and enjoy the tidal pool en-route. Good cafe at Cabbage Tree Bay (albeit expensive but you're paying for the view)

Sheltered family beach. As its more like a bay its good for family outings. Its so named because of the abundance of mostly broken bits of shell so watch the feet in the shallow water but a lovely place to swim and relax.
simply stunning. take the walk from manly and make your way around the waterfront. Its gorgeous and an easy walk so good for kids. Take a picnic and hit up the restaurant that's around the corner.
Great diving.. A secluded beach near Manly. Faces north. Great diving & snorkelling.

The start of a really nice walk up to North Head. From Shelly Beach there is a bush track that leads up to North Head. Its a great way to start the day, breakfast in Manly, coffee along the way, see Shelly Beach (have a swim on a nice day) ad continue up to the bushland tracks on Nortsh Head. Spectacular views of Manly and Sydney Harbour await!

Bit of a Sydney-sider secret. When tourists come to Sydney, they usually have heard of a few of the largest beaches, like Bondi, Manly and Coogee. Shelly beach is not one of those. It's much smaller for starters, probably only about 100 metres across, and it's directly opposite of Manly. The great thing about it is that because it's opposite of Manly, it actually faces back towards the mainland, so the waves don't hit it. Now, if you're there to surf, forget it, but if you want to swim or snorkel, it really is ideal because the peninsula of which the beach is a part, shields you from the waves and makes swimming very pleasant. The beach is very kid-friendly, as it's shallow for a little while. The water is usually very clear, and snorkelling is very rewarding. Lots and lots of fish all over the place, and even some really big blue gophers, and if you're lucky, even a couple of bottom-dwelling rays or Wobbegong sharks (all not dangerous).
Lovely little beach. Nice position, not too big, not too crowded. No waves and you have to walk to get something to eat. But a nice place to visit.

Great sheltered cove next to Manly. Worth the walk around the waters edge from the southern end of Manly beach past the surf life saving club building. Nice restaurant at Shelly Beach and calm clear water fro a swim when yo get there. If you snorkel you can usually see the resident Blue Groper in the deeper water. Safe swim option if you are not confident in the surf beach. Warning- too many tourists drown in the surf in Australia so take care on the exposed main beaches.
Snorkelling. Excellent facilities and well worth a walk out to the beach. Amazingly colurful fish and the area is well protected from the big waves and you do get a nice swell.

Pleasant location. We actually didn't intend to get to Shelly Beach, it was one of our first days in Sydney, we took the ferry to Manly and felt like having a walk, so we just started walking down the right hand side of Manly Beach. Turns out that was a very good choice, after passing the lovely Ocean Pool you get to Shelly Beach, where you can either stay for a while (I remember the restaurant being very pricey so try to skip that) or head up the cliffs for some panorama views! I believe it's not as busy as the main beach and it is an enjoyable walk when the weather is good
Lovely secluded spot. Walk from Queenscliff Beach through to Manly and to Shelly....and then have a swim.Perfect
Dirty and full of cigarette buts a real shame. Its a beautiful spot but it is spoilt by people just trashing the place, real sad
PARADISE. This is a great walk from Manly to Shelly Beach. Lot's of snorkelling, walks around the headland & a great restaurant & cafe there for all to enjoy.
A little beauty. A sight for sore eyes and a lovely walk. Sheltered and great for that special snap.
Snorkelling. We Sydneysiders are so lucky - this place is a total paradise - some people have to travel the globe to see this!!
So Pretty. Lovely beach with pretty good snorkelling off the beach and coffee shop nearby

Great wee dive spot. Great spot for diving as it is a reserve-we have seen numerous wobbegongs, Port Jackson sharks here, a giant cuttlefish, octopus, spotted shrimp, friendly groupers, rays, wrasse-every dive you see something cool. Pretty easy to navigate also.
Pleasant. A safe and pleasant beach to the south of the main Manly beach. Well served by a cafe, toilets and a restaurant and afforded some shelter from the surf by the headland.
Awesome snorkeling.. Great snorkeling, not as well known as the big beaches, and protected from the wind. 'Nuff said.

Quiet Protected Beach. It is a short easy walk from the ferry wharf and Manly Corso along the beach pathway.
Nice views of the coastline
Safe and sheltered beach for families with small children.
Kiosk for coffee and a snack.

Gorgeous quieter beach then Manly. Nice walk from Manly ..
Great on weekdays if you can get there in Summer mornings
Good place to snorkel too

Walk from Manly to Shelly and see some of the best views around. You could swim from Manly if you are keen or casually walk along. There are some Cafe's and restaurants at the end and it is also a great place to learn how to Scuba Dive. Walk around Shelley Point to have a rugged view of the coastline.

Great sheltered beach idea for the young ones.. Nice little kiosk and restaurant there as well. Snorkling, swimming or just to have a picnic. No parking you need to walk in for access but its not taxing at all.
Chilled beach. This small beach which is a short walk away from Manly beach has no waves so safe to bring your litte ones. BBQ facility is a plus.

Amazing Shelly Beach to Nth Head walk in Sydney. When you get to Manly Beach follow the beach path around to Shelly Beach. At the top of Shelly Beach is a car park with a dirt path near the cliff top that is the start of the walk. Go up the path and you come to some rock stairs that take you to the 1st lookout. You slowly follow the path through a old rock wall past the Old Quarry (now a billabong) then to the old School of Artillery. The walk takes about 2-4 hrs depending on how much you stop and take photo's. You will see a Hanging Swamp, Observation Post, Nth Fort, Old Quarantine Cemetery from 1881, the City and Nthn lookouts back down through the to the Army barracks. From there you can walk on down to Collins Beach and then follow the path to Little Manly back to East Esplanade beach and the Ferry..

best place in sydney. if your not looking for a good swell to surf, it's the best of Sydney’s beaches. Located in lovely Manly it offers a protected beach with a small kiosk/coffee-shop. Excellent snorkeling and/or scuba diving as it is a marine reserve. Nice Walk from Manly’s main beach.Not far from the ferry either.If you get bored and want to hit the surf – just change the location to Manly’s North or South Steyne beach.
Fish spotting. Above average for snorkeling and families with young kids. Safe bay with calm waters, no surf. Excellent place to have a breakfast and coffee in local kiosk terrace.
